commit_message:
Pin rabbitmq package version

This patch implements a pinned RabbitMQ package version which is
downloaded (by default) from the official RabbitMQ package download
location.

The user has the ability to use the following variables in order to
override where the package downloads from and what version is
downloaded:
 - rabbitmq_version: the package version
 - rabbitmq_repo_url: the base url to download from
 - rabbitmq_package_url: the full url including the base, the path and
   the package file name

Conflicts:
        rpc_deployment/inventory/group_vars/rabbit.yml
        rpc_deployment/roles/rabbit_common/tasks/main.yml

Partial-Bug: #1412898
Change-Id: I206daf4df18aa90d975f979a656de60a06e7c8f3
(cherry picked from commit 7fcf6026b783ca079c760d3ac6ce29fbfcc8d6ad)

commit_message:
Store all package repo URLs in variables

This change stores the URL of each package repo in a variable
to allow for them to be overridable through user configuration.

Change-Id: I2e25029dab4969181a4481af68ed802414e8d5c1
Closes-Bug: 1414880
(cherry picked from commit c7f37d6efc570071e4733035a573b464e6b0d3b3)

commit_message:
Remove deprecated openstack::swift::notify::ceilometer class

openstack::swift::notify::ceilometer no longer exist and ceilometer
configuration has been moved into openstack::swift::proxy class.
See Idbfa7db5b5debdf5fe4ead33125284178971bc8f for details.

Change-Id: I921767214555f36651149490b09a45e64ef5f340
Closes-bug: #1423544

commit_message:
Update mtms_str to invoke as property

Base pypowervm API changed the mtms_str from a method to property.  This
broke boot up of the compute agent.  This updates the agent to use the
property.

Change-Id: I03670285ba6c9c01628e924de393c07a801d46f4

subject: Assume a new developer won't create a "desinate" user in the dev guide
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-19 20:04:41.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/examples/basic-config-sample.conf', 'doc/source/install/ubuntu-dev.rst'], 'message': 'Assume a new developer won't create a "desinate" user in the dev guide

The getting started docs suggest checking the code out into `/var/lib`,
but this requires a later step of adding a `designate` user to the
sudoers list without adding a step of adding the `designate` user in the
first place.

This updates the docs and basic config example to simply check out the
code into `$HOME/openstack/designate/` and removes sudoers step.

Closes-Bug: 1423628
Change-Id: I0a30e308aec428f4615c55de6b7c3a5f4292f7b1
'}]
commit_message:
Assume a new developer won't create a "desinate" user in the dev guide

The getting started docs suggest checking the code out into `/var/lib`,
but this requires a later step of adding a `designate` user to the
sudoers list without adding a step of adding the `designate` user in the
first place.

This updates the docs and basic config example to simply check out the
code into `$HOME/openstack/designate/` and removes sudoers step.

Closes-Bug: 1423628
Change-Id: I0a30e308aec428f4615c55de6b7c3a5f4292f7b1

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-10 18:54:43.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'exclude functional tests from unit test runs

Unit tests should not run any of the functional tests. The functional
tests should be explicitly run by the user.

The `keystone_excludes` references can be removed once all of the
existing tests have been split into either the functional or unit test
directories. I am choosing not to do the split now so that we have
time to evaluate and maybe rewrite (if necessary) before the move. We

before all of that work is complete.

bp functional-tests

Change-Id: Ic181404b9bbb926cf3fe23f245f5252796542f56
'}]
commit_message:
exclude functional tests from unit test runs

Unit tests should not run any of the functional tests. The functional
tests should be explicitly run by the user.

The `keystone_excludes` references can be removed once all of the
existing tests have been split into either the functional or unit test
directories. I am choosing not to do the split now so that we have
time to evaluate and maybe rewrite (if necessary) before the move. We
are starting to write functional tests and need to be able to run them
before all of that work is complete.

bp functional-tests

Change-Id: Ic181404b9bbb926cf3fe23f245f5252796542f56

commit_message:
Tempest changes

This change does the following:

* updates neutron ansible library to support adding networks, subnets,
  routers, etc.
* updates tempest_resources to create network/subnet/router,
  tempest-specific flavors, and swift reseller role
* updates tempest.conf to disable neutron features which don't work in
  our environment and other minor changes
* updates tempest.conf to enable swift tests depending on whether
  tempest_swift_enabled is set (we also create
  inventory/group_vars/tempest_all.yml defaulting this to true)

Conflicts:
        rpc_deployment/library/neutron

Change-Id: I607ec6556d792573f1f56ab1d29bbcf97b1f39ce
(cherry picked from commit 6f3496bae518a6f8bf13b70404e6f2da48e609b7)

subject: Add role for tempest to allow set image location
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7217, 'name': 'Hugh Saunders', 'email': 'hugh@wherenow.org', 'username': 'hughsaunders'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 9884, 'name': 'Wherenow.org CI', 'email': 'jenkins@wherenow.org', 'username': 'wherenowjenkins', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-19 14:51:14.000000000', 'files': ['rpc_deployment/roles/tempest_resources/tasks/main.yml', 'rpc_deployment/vars/repo_packages/python_glanceclient.yml', 'rpc_deployment/library/neutron', 'rpc_deployment/vars/repo_packages/tempest.yml', 'rpc_deployment/roles/glance_common/templates/policy.json', 'rpc_deployment/roles/tempest/templates/tempest.conf.j2', 'rpc_deployment/vars/repo_packages/python_saharaclient.yml'], 'message': 'Add role for tempest to allow set image location

Recent glance policy additions prevent non admins from setting image
location and therefore creating remote images. Tempest users need this
functionality, so this patch adds a role to those users and a policy to
allow that role to set image location.

The change that allows users to specify roles to be added to tempest
users has already been merged upstream:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/147542/

In order to use the upstream tempest changes, I had to bump the tempest
sha, which in turn required some client package upgrades:

 * tempest to 3feb4d4e1f9367269a226f788ff468f820751340
 * python-glanceclient to 0.15.0
 * python-saharaclient to 0.7.6

Conflicts:
        rpc_deployment/library/neutron

commit_message:
Add role for tempest to allow set image location

Recent glance policy additions prevent non admins from setting image
location and therefore creating remote images. Tempest users need this
functionality, so this patch adds a role to those users and a policy to
allow that role to set image location.

The change that allows users to specify roles to be added to tempest
users has already been merged upstream:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/147542/

In order to use the upstream tempest changes, I had to bump the tempest
sha, which in turn required some client package upgrades:

 * tempest to 3feb4d4e1f9367269a226f788ff468f820751340
 * python-glanceclient to 0.15.0
 * python-saharaclient to 0.7.6

Conflicts:
        rpc_deployment/library/neutron
        rpc_deployment/roles/tempest_resources/tasks/main.yml
        rpc_deployment/vars/repo_packages/python_glanceclient.yml
        rpc_deployment/vars/repo_packages/python_saharaclient.yml
        rpc_deployment/vars/repo_packages/tempest.yml

Change-Id: I9ed053bf70680db54b1cf679a171d61ea639f19d
Closes-Bug: #1411599
(cherry picked from commit a5ab931267c613d4cf802a1c0158bc602b99fd84)

commit_message:
Use mock from standard library in py3x env

There is no possibility to use mock library from pypi with python 3.4
because of bug [1], so there is a sense to use unittest.mock  with py3x.

Added mock to six.moves, imports fixed.

[1] https://code.google.com/p/mock/issues/detail?id=234

Change-Id: I1c7d438892ba494f54451084ef0b68da091f18ab

commit_message:
Removes information on fuel-plugins repo

Since Fuel plugins are now kept in separate repos under
Stackforge project, let's remove information about

commit_message:
Add AB testing code to docs.mirantis.com layout

The marketing team needs to be able to do AB testing on
docs.mirantis.com.

This commit places an AB testing js code in the doc layout
right after the </title> tag on all the pages at docs.mirantis.com.

Closes-Bug: 1328069

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-18 21:47:24.000000000', 'files': ['security-guide/section_tls-proxies-and-http-services.xml'], 'message': 'Update TLS config recommendations

Session tickets are tricky business. Using them correctly requires some
additional thinking and tooling. This updates our suggested configs
for Apache and Nginx to disable session tickets. And this also provides
a mention of the issue for people to be aware of the situation.

Change-Id: I70fe086a97d5c2db74c85b1b0fe16bf65b0339c4

commit_message:
Update TLS config recommendations

Session tickets are tricky business. Using them correctly requires some
additional thinking and tooling. This updates our suggested configs
for Apache and Nginx to disable session tickets. And this also provides
a mention of the issue for people to be aware of the situation.

Change-Id: I70fe086a97d5c2db74c85b1b0fe16bf65b0339c4
Closes-Bug: 1418661

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-18 05:46:33.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/identity/core.py'], 'message': 'Removes unnecessary checks when cleaning a domain

When an internal notification for cleaning up a
domain was sent, the callback method was checking
the domain_id from users and groups, which is
unnecessary since they were filtered by that

Closes-Bug: #1409211

Change-Id: I151e8c7af885a9b3681b08bc47de443910a753bb
'}]
commit_message:
Removes unnecessary checks when cleaning a domain

When an internal notification for cleaning up a
domain was sent, the callback method was checking
the domain_id from users and groups, which is
unnecessary since they were filtered by that
value.

Closes-Bug: #1409211

Change-Id: I151e8c7af885a9b3681b08bc47de443910a753bb

commit_message:
fake: fix public API signatures to match virt driver

The fake driver had a number of places where it did not
correctly follow the API signature of the virt driver.
Fix them, and add a test to validate it.

Change-Id: I7b0b3855a0dd291a71ccfc9e5afb0235ed7536f0

commit_message:
Update vCenter hypervisor screenshot in wizard

In Fuel 6.0, vCenter settings can take not only IP address,
but also Hostname in the corresponding field.

Two screenshots are updated:

* for wizard (hv)
* for Fuel web UI (Settings tab)

Change-Id: Id798e862871ba5876c0191cfdb9b1a1479531608
Closes-Bug: 1401169

commit_message:
Namespace PYPI_MIRROR_URL vars with DIB

We have a good pattern of namespacing env vars with DIB_. Add support
for DIB_PYPI_MIRROR_URL* and maintain backwards compat support.

commit_message:
Allow setting OS_DEBUG_LOGGING

In t-i-e I37d8391a4984f2c34368724212c81d10dbab2dee we start supporting
an env variable OS_DEUBUG_LOGGING which controls whether we set debug
logs at build time. If -d is passed to devtest* we should be setting
this.

Change-Id: I3bb21a289d2c0d65ff1eb6865e70f2d9b554f7fb

subject: Fix data leakage in multiple object versions
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 15090, 'name': 'Elvis Teixeira', 'email': 'elvis.teixeira@lsbd.ufc.br', 'username': 'ElvisTeixeira'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-13 18:22:37.000000000', 'files': ['swift/proxy/controllers/obj.py'], 'message': 'Fix data leakage in multiple object versions

When two or more containers were set to send object
versions to the same destination container and both
had versioned files with the same name each retrieved
the newest version possibly getting data from the
other one. Now versions carry information from their
source container.

Change-Id: I445a4e8584b431dedc204b8b1acc9af13b401329
Closes-Bug: #1138531
'}]
commit_message:
Fix data leakage in multiple object versions

When two or more containers were set to send object
versions to the same destination container and both
had versioned files with the same name each retrieved
the newest version possibly getting data from the
other one. Now versions carry information from their
source container.

Change-Id: I445a4e8584b431dedc204b8b1acc9af13b401329
Closes-Bug: #1138531

commit_message:
Build wheel cache for venvs

Building a bunch of virtual envs later is going to be tedious if we do not
pre-cache certain annoying-to-build packages.

* tools/build_wheels.sh: pre-build some wheels for annoying package installs
* list distro package dependencies in files/*/venv
* list packages to pre-build as wheels in files/venv-requirements.txt
* install database Python modules when setting up the database

Change-Id: Idff1ea69a5ca12ba56098e664dbf6924fe6a2e47

commit_message:
Separate TOSCA capabilities definition from assignment

With introduction of new TOSCA capabilities like OperatingSystem, Scalability
etc., TOSCA capabilites are now more mature and complex. This separation
provides cleaner approach.

Partially Implements: blueprint tosca-compute-os-capability

Change-Id: I9af208741f01eb9ebc74c41b10d0a7bfda9d2e5d

commit_message:
Work correctly if hmac.compare_digest isn't available

The hmac.compare_digest function provides nice constant time
functionality but unfortunately isn't available in python
versions < 2.7.7

This pep (included in python 2.7.9) changes the behaviour of SSL
certificate chain handling to be more py3 like.

Include required new exception behaviour in the list of
exceptions to translate under py2.

https://github.com/python/peps/blob/master/pep-0476.txt

'}]
commit_message:
Update HTTPS certificate handling for pep-0476

This pep (included in python 2.7.9) changes the behaviour of SSL
certificate chain handling to be more py3 like.

Include required new exception behaviour in the list of
exceptions to translate under py2.

https://github.com/python/peps/blob/master/pep-0476.txt

Closes-Bug: 1404227

Change-Id: I7da1a13d1ec861a07fd96684d0431508a214a2c8

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 9410, 'name': 'Yanis Guenane', 'email': 'yguenane@redhat.com', 'username': 'yguenane'}, {'_account_id': 9500, 'name': 'Matt Fischer', 'email': 'matt@mattfischer.com', 'username': 'mfisch'}, {'_account_id': 10540, 'name': "Clayton O'Neill", 'email': 'clayton.oneill@charter.com', 'username': 'coneill'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-02-18 17:27:18.000000000', 'files': ['spec/defines/openstacklib_policy_spec.rb', 'manifests/policy/base.pp'], 'message': 'Properly handle policy values containing spaces

Add quotes around the ${value} for the augeas resources, which
will properly handle values that contain spaces.  Otherwise,
the value gets truncated at the first space.

Change-Id: I24ee5312a0e492e264b38756649654b9d5930f4c
Closes-bug: 1416523
'}]
commit_message:
Properly handle policy values containing spaces

Add quotes around the ${value} for the augeas resources, which
will properly handle values that contain spaces.  Otherwise,
the value gets truncated at the first space.

Change-Id: I24ee5312a0e492e264b38756649654b9d5930f4c
Closes-bug: 1416523

Add different operators relative to dialect.
It's needed to support same regexp format for all backends.

commit_message:
Set a higher default for maxDiff

testtools.TestCase.maxDiff is the number of characters
shown when two objects do not match for assertDictEqual,
assertMultiLineEqual, and assertSequenceEqual. The
default is 640 which is too low for comparing most dicts.

Change-Id: I1cb7b12b1a7491637b695abe76207b6db8a65fb5

subject: Avoid deregistering conductor following SIGUSR1
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6618, 'name': 'Ruby Loo', 'email': 'opensrloo@gmail.com', 'username': 'rloo'}, {'_account_id': 9315, 'name': 'ramesh', 'email': 'rameshg87@gmail.com', 'username': 'rameshg87'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 12081, 'name': 'IBM xCAT CI', 'email': 'xcat@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibm-xcat-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12356, 'name': 'Vladyslav Drok', 'email': 'vdrok@mirantis.com', 'username': 'vdrok'}, {'_account_id': 14826, 'name': 'Mark Goddard', 'email': 'markgoddard86@gmail.com', 'username': 'mgoddard'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-02-19 09:34:53.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/conductor/test_manager.py', 'ironic/common/service.py', 'ironic/conductor/manager.py'], 'message': 'Avoid deregistering conductor following SIGUSR1

Allow the conductor to avoid deregistering itself on shutdown, after
receiving a SIGUSR1 signal. The registration will time out after a
period defined by the conductor.heartbeat_timeout configuration setting
(defaults to 60 seconds). If the conductor is restarted within this
period, the unnecessary thrash caused by two ring rebalances will be
avoided. This is useful in situations where the downtime is negligible,
such as an upgrade.

DocImpact
Closes-bug: #1418474
Change-Id: Ie40a7f878c2845dc9cb8fc8082df5d88adb28d0b
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid deregistering conductor following SIGUSR1

Allow the conductor to avoid deregistering itself on shutdown, after
receiving a SIGUSR1 signal. The registration will time out after a
period defined by the conductor.heartbeat_timeout configuration setting
(defaults to 60 seconds). If the conductor is restarted within this
period, the unnecessary thrash caused by two ring rebalances will be
avoided. This is useful in situations where the downtime is negligible,
such as an upgrade.

DocImpact
Closes-bug: #1418474
Change-Id: Ie40a7f878c2845dc9cb8fc8082df5d88adb28d0b

commit_message:
Revert "Remove RPC dependency to create FIP agent gw port"

This reverts commit 9c9db24738161aef465489b320e6f54a94b4cac7.

This commit broke tripleo-ci, with reports of a missing L3
agent on a compute node.

Change-Id: I0360f33100363200379f3880427a919e1ec579aa
Closes-Bug: #1423228

subject: Change SNMP 'hardware.memory.used' metric to reflect (memTotalReal - memAvailReal) which is the used value for the memory for a physical machine. This has to be done as SNMP does not provide a memory metric for used that can be directly used.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-19 05:08:26.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/hardware/inspector/snmp.py'], 'message': "Change SNMP 'hardware.memory.used' metric to reflect (memTotalReal - memAvailReal) which is the used value for the memory for a physical machine.
This has to be done as SNMP does not provide a memory metric for used that can be directly used.

Change-Id: I3c2be2dee65c278d99144ebf1cd8b0db1adfff6d
"}]
commit_message:
Change SNMP 'hardware.memory.used' metric to reflect (memTotalReal - memAvailReal) which is the used value for the memory for a physical machine.
This has to be done as SNMP does not provide a memory metric for used that can be directly used.

Change-Id: I3c2be2dee65c278d99144ebf1cd8b0db1adfff6d

Add clean_exit for py-pgsql unit tests

tests fails. In this patchset clean_exit function for postgresql
have been added.

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 11029, 'name': 'Jamie Finnigan', 'email': 'jamiefinnigan@gmail.com', 'username': 'jamiefinnigan'}, {'_account_id': 11716, 'name': 'Tim Kelsey', 'email': 'timothy.kelsey@uk.ibm.com', 'username': 'tkelsey'}, {'_account_id': 11861, 'name': 'Travis McPeak', 'email': 'tmcpeak@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'travis-mcpeak'}, {'_account_id': 14692, 'name': 'Lucas Fisher', 'email': 'lucas.fisher@gmail.com', 'username': 'lucas.fisher'}]

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-19 05:58:18.000000000', 'files': ['bandit/plugins/exec.py', 'bandit/plugins/general_bad_file_permissions.py', 'bandit/plugins/general_bind_all_interfaces.py', 'bandit/plugins/blacklist_calls.py', 'bandit/plugins/injection_sql.py', 'bandit/plugins/general_hardcoded_password.py', 'bandit/plugins/injection_wildcard.py', 'bandit/plugins/crypto_request_no_cert_validation.py', 'bandit/core/test_properties.py', 'bandit/core/node_visitor.py', 'bandit/plugins/insecure_ssl_tls.py', 'bandit/core/test_set.py', 'bandit/plugins/injection_shell.py', 'bandit/plugins/blacklist_imports.py', 'bandit/plugins/crypto_random.py', 'bandit/plugins/general_hardcoded_tmp.py'], 'message': "Further decorator changes and plugin migration

Continuing to deliver the refactor discussed during the OSSG mid-cycle.

This change completes the definition of new decorators to be applied
at the plugin/test level.  It also migrates existing tests over to use
one of the new decorators, using checks() instead of the checks_*()
functions.

With the checks_*() decorators we had tried to abstract away from the
AST nodes.  That was overly-complicating the framework, and there's
value to be had from understanding the AST, so we're removing that
abstraction.

Tests will now be able to use the checks() decorator and include the
AST nodes they can be executed against.  For example:

@checks('Import', 'ImportFrom')
def random_lib_imports(context):
[..]

@checks('Call')
def ssl_with_bad_version(context, config):
[..]

This change also cleans up the definition of additional new decorators
(severity(), category(), title(), uuid()) which future commits will build
out the framework further to utilize.

Change-Id: I32017d21ed897b087ddfc249ebb5b604a9a832fa
"}]
commit_message:
Further decorator changes and plugin migration

Continuing to deliver the refactor discussed during the OSSG mid-cycle.

This change completes the definition of new decorators to be applied
at the plugin/test level.  It also migrates existing tests over to use
one of the new decorators, using checks() instead of the checks_*()
functions.

With the checks_*() decorators we had tried to abstract away from the
AST nodes.  That was overly-complicating the framework, and there's
value to be had from understanding the AST, so we're removing that
abstraction.

Tests will now be able to use the checks() decorator and include the
AST nodes they can be executed against.  For example:

@checks('Import', 'ImportFrom')
def random_lib_imports(context):
[..]

@checks('Call')
def ssl_with_bad_version(context, config):
[..]

This change also cleans up the definition of additional new decorators
(severity(), category(), title(), uuid()) which future commits will build
out the framework further to utilize.

Change-Id: I32017d21ed897b087ddfc249ebb5b604a9a832fa

commit_message:
Utilize polling_interval conf option

The polling_interval CONF option in the agent configuration was not
being utilize.  Instead it had been hardcoded.  This should be utilized
so that administrators have configurability in their polling.

Change-Id: Ib92c6693c820435e7c947140f2f63540d1564eac
Closes-Bug: #1423259

subject: Disentangle tarring in logfiles and increase logging
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1726, 'name': 'Ghe Rivero', 'email': 'ghe.rivero@gmail.com', 'username': 'ghe.rivero'}, {'_account_id': 6133, 'name': 'yolanda.robla', 'email': 'yroblamo@redhat.com', 'username': 'yolanda.robla'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 9369, 'name': 'Steve Kowalik', 'email': 'steven@wedontsleep.org', 'username': 'stevenk'}, {'_account_id': 9453, 'name': 'James Polley', 'email': 'jp@jamezpolley.com', 'username': 'tchaypo'}, {'_account_id': 10035, 'name': 'greghaynes', 'email': 'greg@greghaynes.net', 'username': 'greghaynes'}, {'_account_id': 12459, 'name': 'Stephanie Miller', 'email': 'stephane@alum.mit.edu', 'username': 'cinerama'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-01-28 18:39:57.000000000', 'files': ['toci_devtest.sh'], 'message': "Disentangle tarring in logfiles and increase logging

We're having problems with some part of creating this tarfile; but
trying to create the tarfile and move it across the network all in one
step is making it difficult to figure out what's going wrong.

This change is intended to be slower and more methodical. Instead of
doing this all at once, we use several SSH commands to create a tempdir;
then to create a tarfile inside it; then to scp that file onto our
working machine; then to unpack it.

This will probably be slower, but should give us more information about
how each step is proceeding - which should in turn enable us to figure
out what's breaking and what we can do about it.

Also increasing our ssh log level to Verbose so we see relevant error
messages when our ssh/scp commands fail.

Change-Id: I867869bb516ea70312eaf5f00ec071ad652c44e8
Partial-bug: 1414098
"}]
commit_message:
Disentangle tarring in logfiles and increase logging

We're having problems with some part of creating this tarfile; but
trying to create the tarfile and move it across the network all in one
step is making it difficult to figure out what's going wrong.

This change is intended to be slower and more methodical. Instead of
doing this all at once, we use several SSH commands to create a tempdir;
then to create a tarfile inside it; then to scp that file onto our
working machine; then to unpack it.

This will probably be slower, but should give us more information about
how each step is proceeding - which should in turn enable us to figure
out what's breaking and what we can do about it.

Also increasing our ssh log level to Verbose so we see relevant error
messages when our ssh/scp commands fail.

Change-Id: I867869bb516ea70312eaf5f00ec071ad652c44e8
Partial-bug: 1414098

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-18 22:39:35.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "For flake8 check, make the 'E12' ignore be more granular

ignore = E12 means ignore E12* errors.

commit_message:
For flake8 check, make the 'E12' ignore be more granular

ignore = E12 means ignore E12* errors.

Make it more granular by converting to E121,E122,...,E129

This will make it easier in the future to remove a single ignore and
update the code to resolve the issues.

Change-Id: Iddff6a826bc7c9ff07643b7408c51f1bd129530c

aggregate_update() was explicitly setting values['metadata'] for the
caller. However, it has also popped availability_zone, which it
doesn't replace. Also, other _update() functions in the db api don't
do this after modifying values in place, so anything which assumed

commit_message:
Don't assume contents of values after aggregate_update

aggregate_update() was explicitly setting values['metadata'] for the
caller. However, it has also popped availability_zone, which it
doesn't replace. Also, other _update() functions in the db api don't
do this after modifying values in place, so anything which assumed
this behaviour would be inconsistent.

The only code which did assume this behaviour was in a test. This
patch fixes the test.

Change-Id: Iaa21576655da037e6186e900234e2c29c9e3a652

commit_message:
Run tempest tests with testr

The primary reason for this is that test skips exceptions are
interpreted as skips not errors.

A secondary benefit is that testr revolves around tasks lists so we can
fine tune the task list without modifying tempest code.

Related:
  * XML tests failing: https://github.com/rcbops/ansible-lxc-rpc/issues/653
  * Tempest Testing: https://github.com/rcbops/ansible-lxc-rpc/issues/472

Conflicts:
        rpc_deployment/roles/tempest/files/rpc_tempest_gate.sh

Change-Id: I4edb1f9775ff4b1e5f07e40ace40f028c847edeb
(cherry picked from commit 8cac8689d565b0362af7826447d29a1e927953ea)

commit_message:
Implements: blueprint heat-fig-update

Fig is initially being evaluated to provide container set
functionality. Therefore, the heat template needs to be updated
to support running fig on Kolla nodes. This patch adds the
required directories, files, and commands to run fig and a
RabbitMQ container for testing.

Change-Id: Ifad399b43d8ca712a5efbdafe945d055c33b1e77

commit_message:
First pass at VIOS VLAN Provision

This change set provides a first pass of function needed to provision a
VLAN on the VIOS.  Uses the API in pypowervm to enable this.

This change does not remove the vlan off the system.

Change-Id: I246564e8270807791c7b28f26dbea297a74e0af4

model that was added.

commit_message:
Policy enforcement functional tests - scripts

Shell scripts preparing dsvm environment for policy enforcement tests.
Tests require devstack with Congress installed.
Some original scripts where changed to reuse functionality.
Jenkins job https://review.openstack.org/#/c/150401/

Partially Implements blueprint congress-support-in-murano

Change-Id: Ib3c26168043f74d4e7ec76f3557f8857cf4304a4

commit_message:
Fix usage drop_constraint in 2a1ee2fb59e0 migration

Downgrade for migration 2a1ee2fb59e0_add_mac_address_unique_constraint
fails as it gets wrong parameters name, source and local_cols,
although it expects name, source and type_.

Also as MySQL creates index for unique constraint it should be used
"with migration.remove_fks_from_table".

Closes-bug: #1421631

Change-Id: Id86b2f339a6fb33fc4fd637ffbfc2cb6e75ef4fb

commit_message:
Combining sec groups member update RPC calls

This change allows combining multiple RPC calls for
security group member/provider updates that are needed
as a result of create bulk port operations.

Change-Id: Ibfe84f40e55a9847cbcaa4a7344988b2d3fb895e
Closes-Bug: #1373634

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-16 16:32:13.000000000', 'files': ['nova/console/websocketproxy.py', 'nova/tests/unit/console/test_websocketproxy.py'], 'message': "Fix VNC access, when reverse DNS lookups fail

If DNS is configured on a node in a way, so that reverse DNS look ups
time out, noVNC will fail to connect to an instance with 'Connect
timeout' error.

The reverse DNS look up is done implicitly in BaseHTTPRequestHandler
(part of standard library), when logging a request. It's not
configurable, so the only way to disable it is to override the method
of the base class.

This is only true for the standard http server (used for novncproxy),
as the eventlet implementation (used for xvpvncproxy) seems to use
plain IP addresses without any reverse DNS look ups.

Closes-Bug: #1422315

Change-Id: I8b922de49134eda4d753a8e906b0de55203877d3
"}]
commit_message:
Fix VNC access, when reverse DNS lookups fail

If DNS is configured on a node in a way, so that reverse DNS look ups
time out, noVNC will fail to connect to an instance with 'Connect
timeout' error.

The reverse DNS look up is done implicitly in BaseHTTPRequestHandler
(part of standard library), when logging a request. It's not
configurable, so the only way to disable it is to override the method
of the base class.

This is only true for the standard http server (used for novncproxy),
as the eventlet implementation (used for xvpvncproxy) seems to use
plain IP addresses without any reverse DNS look ups.

Closes-Bug: #1422315

Change-Id: I8b922de49134eda4d753a8e906b0de55203877d3

commit_message:
Support live-migrate of instances in PAUSED state

Live migration enables one to migrate an active VM that consumes
system resources such as memory and CPU.

Nova currently allows only those in ACTIVE vm_state to migrate.  This
patch adds support for PAUSED vm_state. Essentially a paused state is
identical to a running state except the stopped CPUs.

Co-Author: "Matthew Gilliard <matthew.gilliard@hp.com>"

Partial-Bug: #1305062
Change-Id: Ib38eaf412cb51a9cbfc443c5ec15c5797265ddae

commit_message:
Pass the capabilities to ironic node instance_info

This commit is to pass on the `capabilities` defined in `extra-spec`
key of the flavor to node's instance_info field. It copies the
key and value pair to the instance_info without any manipulation
in the value.

Implements : blueprint pass-flavor-capabilities-to-ironic-virt-driver

DocImpact

Change-Id: Id8ae681ce69f66da4b6579c40aff8d2eda96666d

commit_message:
libvirt: cleanup setattr usage in test_host

There is some suspect setattr/delattr in test_host for mocking out
VIR_CONNECT_BASELINE_CPU_EXPAND_FEATURES. This can be easily stubbed out
with mock and the create=True kwarg so we can remove the setattr
ugliness.

Note that if you decorate a test method with a mock and use the new
kwarg, the stub isn't passed as an argument to the test method.

Change-Id: I414ac96b089f297c35fa821b926546290ac66bdc

commit_message:
libvirt: add TODOs for removing libvirt attribute stubs

This goes through and adds TODOs to several stubs set in libvirt tests
where fakelibvirt isn't used if a real libvirt is in the environment,
but if the version of libvirt is old enough that it doesn't have the
attributes, the tests fail with AttributeError. These are markers to
cleanup once we've removed the ability to test against a real libvirt in
the *unit* tests and rely on fakelibvirt only.

Note that there are a couple of tests were attributes are explicitly set
to test negative cases, e.g. setting VIR_DOMAIN_XML_MIGRATABLE to None
for workaround flows in the driver code with older libvirts during
migrations.

This also adds the constants VIR_DOMAIN_XML_UPDATE_CPU and
VIR_DOMAIN_XML_MIGRATABLE to fakelibvirt to prepare for an eventual
cutover to fakelibvirt only tests.

Related-Bug: #1422385

Change-Id: Ib8098131b564934c0e96b4dda71c6810054f3d73

commit_message:
Fixes Attribute Error when trying to spawn instance from vhd on HyperV

When trying to boot an instance from a vhd image we get a AttributeError.
This happens when we try to get the root disk size from the old flavor.
Since on creation there is no old flavor, instance.get_flavor() will return
None and thus the AttributeError when trying to return te root_gb.

This patch fixes this problem by checking if the return value from
instance.get_flavor() is None, in which case it returns
instance.root_gb.

Change-Id: Ief16679a6b80f6f8b9246ea6a50773e40824bb7f
Closes-Bug: 1421272

commit_message:
Fix return value inconsistency in VNX Driver

When iscsi_initiators option for EMC Cinder Driver has no value,
a dict object is returned by find_available_iscsi_targets() in
EMC Cinder Driver while a list is expected. Thus an
initialize_connection() will fail due to the inconsistency.

This patch is to fix this inconsistency in the driver.

Change-Id: I094340cc60da4a8b423233983a1d00784bbbb8ea
Closes-Bug: 1422563

commit_message:
WIP start adding gabbi tests to gnocchi

This doesn't cover everything yet, I'm posting it just to get some
first glance review and sanity checking on how I'm doing the database
setup.

The gabbi tests are integrated with the other tests such that
existing tox targets will call them. This requires making
a ConfigFixture that each gabbi yaml file uses. The upshot of this
is that database and conf handling is per file and relatively
clear cut. The fixture will clean up created databases and temp
files.

It is also possible to run the gabbi tests with their own tox
target: tox -epy27-gabbi.

There are three test files thus far:

* base.yaml requests / and makes sure there is a world
* archive.yaml covers some basic archive policy handling
* resource.yaml starts investigating resource handling.
* metric.yaml starts investigating metric handling.

xfails are used where necessary to ride over bad behavior.

A file-based storage engine is started from the ConfigFixture.

Change-Id: Ic09743af5a19c04cecf28bbc1a42e841e142b600

commit_message:
Steps 'hiera' and 'globals' are requiring for all roles

Without it base-os nodes could not run post-deployment hooks,
for example: hosts.

Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Ilyin <dilyin@mirantis.com>

Closes-Bug: #1422364

commit_message:
Skip tag and push if tag exists

Even though the sanity-checking script reports existing tags,
we still need to look for that condition in oslo_release.sh
and skip the git operations, since they will fail.

Change-Id: Icd86bf90b4bcc4f5349e16fd52d3d2011e30c2c9

commit_message:
Add mode for fake_tasks, fixes hanging task

override_state is added, it makes all tasks created with fake_tasks using
this option fix themselves on 50 progress and 'running' status.

test_rerun_stopped_deploy uses above option for first deploy, which is
meant to be stopped, but couldn't be run in a manner that guarantees
that stop task will be fast enough to stop the deploy.

godmode is replaced by override_state with appropriate parameters

Change-Id: Ie00e3845b8bb2273ce9857b789071705c81d2b34
Closes-Bug: #1419046

commit_message:
Rename volume_type to share_type

This change renames support for volume_type to share_type.
The manila client will send data to Manila API using share_type, but
passes both share_type and volume_type values returned from API call to users
of the python binding; however, CLI output will only print the value of
share_type. This change ensures that --volume-type (and its other
permutations) are aliases of --share-type, thus providing backwards
compatibility for command line arguments of the shell.

Change-Id: Id40eea27c2c5b44e1d01c061a48e1658ba800f43

generic setup, following upstream ansible best practices.\n\nItems Changed:\n* All tasks have tags.\n* All roles use namespaced variables.\n* All redundant tasks within a given play and role have been removed.\n* All of the repetitive plays have been removed in-favor of a more\n  simplistic approach. This change duplicates code within the roles but\n  ensures that the roles only ever run within their own scope.\n* All roles have been built using an ansible galaxy syntax.\n* The `*requirement.txt` files have been reformatted follow upstream\n  Openstack practices.\n* Dynamically generated inventory is now more organized, this should assist\n  anyone who may want or need to dive into the JSON blob that is created.\n  In the inventory a properties field is used for items that customize containers\n  within the inventory.\n* The environment map has been modified to support additional host groups to\n  enable the seperation of infrastructure pieces. While the old infra_hosts group\n  will still work this change allows for groups to be divided up into seperate\n  chunks; eg: deployment of a swift only stack.\n* The LXC logic now exists within the plays.\n* etc/openstack_deploy/user_variables.yml has all password/token\n  variables extracted into the separate file\n  etc/openstack_deploy/user_secrets.yml in order to allow seperate\n  security settings on that file.\n\nItems Excised:\n* All of the roles have had the LXC logic removed from within them which\n  should allow roles to be consumed outside of the `os-ansible-deployment`\n  reference architecture.\n\nNote:\n* the directory rpc_deployment still exists and is presently pointed at plays\n  containing a deprecation warning instructing the user to move to the standard\n  playbooks directory.\n* While all of the rackspace specific components and variables have been removed\n  and or were refactored the repository still relies on an upstream mirror of\n  Openstack built python files and container images. This upstream mirror is hosted\n  at rackspace at "http://rpc-repo.rackspace.com" though this is\n  not locked to and or tied to rackspace specific installations. This repository\n  contains all of the needed code to create and/or clone your own mirror.\n\nDocImpact\nCo-Authored-By: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>\nCloses-Bug: #1403676\nImplements: blueprint galaxy-roles\nChange-Id: I03df3328b7655f0cc9e43ba83b02623d038d214e\n'}]
commit_message:
Convert existing roles into galaxy roles

This change implements the blueprint to convert all roles and plays into
a more generic setup, following upstream ansible best practices.

Items Changed:
* All tasks have tags.
* All roles use namespaced variables.
* All redundant tasks within a given play and role have been removed.
* All of the repetitive plays have been removed in-favor of a more
  simplistic approach. This change duplicates code within the roles but
  ensures that the roles only ever run within their own scope.
* All roles have been built using an ansible galaxy syntax.
* The `*requirement.txt` files have been reformatted follow upstream
  Openstack practices.
* Dynamically generated inventory is now more organized, this should assist
  anyone who may want or need to dive into the JSON blob that is created.
  In the inventory a properties field is used for items that customize containers
  within the inventory.
* The environment map has been modified to support additional host groups to
  enable the seperation of infrastructure pieces. While the old infra_hosts group
  will still work this change allows for groups to be divided up into seperate
  chunks; eg: deployment of a swift only stack.
* The LXC logic now exists within the plays.
* etc/openstack_deploy/user_variables.yml has all password/token
  variables extracted into the separate file
  etc/openstack_deploy/user_secrets.yml in order to allow seperate
  security settings on that file.

Items Excised:
* All of the roles have had the LXC logic removed from within them which
  should allow roles to be consumed outside of the `os-ansible-deployment`
  reference architecture.

Note:
* the directory rpc_deployment still exists and is presently pointed at plays
  containing a deprecation warning instructing the user to move to the standard
  playbooks directory.
* While all of the rackspace specific components and variables have been removed
  and or were refactored the repository still relies on an upstream mirror of
  Openstack built python files and container images. This upstream mirror is hosted
  at rackspace at "http://rpc-repo.rackspace.com" though this is
  not locked to and or tied to rackspace specific installations. This repository
  contains all of the needed code to create and/or clone your own mirror.

DocImpact
Co-Authored-By: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>
Closes-Bug: #1403676
Implements: blueprint galaxy-roles
Change-Id: I03df3328b7655f0cc9e43ba83b02623d038d214e

commit_message:
remove the Conf.signing.token_format option support

In the doc string, it clearly states that we ensure backwards
compatibility for Conf.signing.token_format until Havana + 2.
Now, we are in the Kilo development cycle, we can remove this
support.

partially-implements blueprint removed-as-of-kilo
Closes-Bug: #1406172
Change-Id: I3cd1e2e5a51c4a87edf00647bc1b95a0347e3316

commit_message:
Reduce galera gcache size for commit check on AIO

This patch reduces the galera cache size for the AIO configuration in
order to improve the success of tempest tests on a low memory instance.

Conflicts:
        scripts/gate-check-commit.sh

Partial-Bug: #1419094
Change-Id: I837abe7d53a862e2b3838f66f9cc90d4eb02fafd

This patch updates the tempest resources play to create all the

Also defaults gate-check-commit RUN_TEMPEST and DEPLOY_TEMPEST variables
to yes.

Several other improvements were required to get tempest to run.
* The AIO interfaces file was changed to allow for proper networking of
  a flat network within an environment.
* ml2_conf.ini a variable was added to override an assumed network
  interface on a physical host.
* rpc_tempest_gate.sh was updated to allow for commit_aio testing.
* The gate scripts were update to support running tempest. in the
  environment.

Co-Authored-By: Hugh Saunders <hugh@wherenow.org>
Closes-Bug: #1419094
Change-Id: Ib92b30f040cf05202d7785c8a3132150d31ef92e
'}]
commit_message:
Enable tempest scenarios for aio

This patch updates the tempest resources play to create all the
pre-requistes for running the commit_aio tempest tests.  This is
currently test_minimum_basic and test_swift_basic_ops.
Also defaults gate-check-commit RUN_TEMPEST and DEPLOY_TEMPEST variables
to yes.

Several other improvements were required to get tempest to run.
* The AIO interfaces file was changed to allow for proper networking of
  a flat network within an environment.
* ml2_conf.ini a variable was added to override an assumed network
  interface on a physical host.
* rpc_tempest_gate.sh was updated to allow for commit_aio testing.
* The gate scripts were update to support running tempest. in the
  environment.

Co-Authored-By: Hugh Saunders <hugh@wherenow.org>
Closes-Bug: #1419094
Change-Id: Ib92b30f040cf05202d7785c8a3132150d31ef92e

commit_message:
For plugins package version 2.0.0 use different data path

To make paths to deployment scripts and repositories
full name of the plugin is used for old plugins, i.e.
"plugin_name-1.2.3", for new plugins with package version
2.0.0 new only name and major version is used, because
during the installation plugin is put in different
directory "plugin_name-1.2".

Also there is additional fix for test to fix "100" < "99"
sorting problem.

Implements: blueprint plugins-security-fixes-delivery
Change-Id: I1711eff50a3d9612cb6d31af492b18356087e438

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-19 00:39:19.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Remove the tempest glusterfs job

This partway through the tempest runs in this jobs the nodes seem to
lose connection with jenkins resulting in zuul restarting the job. This
means these jobs are just restarted over and over and over again. Stop
running these jobs until this is corrected.

Change-Id: Ie515d6d940767c28b774d65b9f8ae64314454e6b
'}]
commit_message:
Remove the tempest glusterfs job

This partway through the tempest runs in this jobs the nodes seem to
lose connection with jenkins resulting in zuul restarting the job. This
means these jobs are just restarted over and over and over again. Stop
running these jobs until this is corrected.

Change-Id: Ie515d6d940767c28b774d65b9f8ae64314454e6b

commit_message:
Implement group related methods for LDAP backend

This patch implements three functions, empty in the LDAP backend,
which are necessary to obtain information about groups,
such as roles, projects and domains of the groups.

These are the functions:

- get_roles_for_groups
- list_projects_for_groups
- list_domains_for_groups

Change-Id: I0020a1a78004cfca1bcec40ecc938d3e2362dba8
Closes-Bug: #1333712

commit_message:
Added --tenant option for keystone authentication

We had 'admin' tenant hardcoded, while for notifications we want other
tenants to be allowed to do notifications via the CLI.

DocImpact
Related-Bug: #1371757

Change-Id: I26399a62440710b63d8fec94213700fb03ab66e8

After starting a new Keystone container, the first attempt to get a token
fails. Unfortunately, the logs keep silent and say nothing. As a

commit_message:
fuel_upgrade: add retries for getting token

After starting a new Keystone container, the first attempt to get a token
fails. Unfortunately, the logs keep silent and say nothing. As a
workaround, we can just increase retries number.

(cherry picked from commit 81e01c06420db7289f1efaaf8eddf172b61dca45)

Change-Id: Ib1bba120614d1964e838c289489f1877074c324d
Closes-Bug: #1403798

subject: Increase mysql/mariadb max-connection
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5803, 'name': 'Attila Fazekas', 'email': 'afazekas@redhat.com', 'username': 'afazekas'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 7350, 'name': 'Jordan Pittier', 'email': 'jordan.pittier@gmail.com', 'username': 'JordanP'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-13 07:48:54.000000000', 'files': ['lib/database', 'lib/databases/mysql', 'lib/databases/postgresql'], 'message': 'Increase mysql/mariadb max-connection

Jobs are failing with "OperationalError" "Too many connections",
error messages.

The postgresql default max connection (100) is already increased to 200,
because of gate issues.

This change increases the default mysql(151) to 200, by using the
same the MAX_DB_CONNECTION environment variable as used
with postgresql.

Change-Id: Ia8308dcaa3a6555a303b0991b8bf6873cc553096
'}]
commit_message:
Increase mysql/mariadb max-connection

Jobs are failing with "OperationalError" "Too many connections",
error messages.

The postgresql default max connection (100) is already increased to 200,
because of gate issues.

This change increases the default mysql(151) to 200, by using the
same the MAX_DB_CONNECTION environment variable as used
with postgresql.

Change-Id: Ia8308dcaa3a6555a303b0991b8bf6873cc553096

This change updates the icehouse global requirements to the latest stable/icehouse
which resolves a number of errors that occur due to python packages not containing
upper and lower boundries.

This will resolve the critical bug where eventlet breaks nova due to incompatibilities

commit_message:
Updates the global requirements to the latest stable/icehouse

This change updates the icehouse global requirements to the latest stable/icehouse
which resolves a number of errors that occur due to python packages not containing
upper and lower boundries.

This will resolve the critical bug where eventlet breaks nova due to incompatibilities
in version >= 16.0.

Change-Id: I6ce3b782b0b030b1023d0201da1b673b328eec99
Closes-Bug: 1419453

commit_message:
Updated the git_repo values to point to github

This commit resolves the issue where git.openstack.org becomes unavailable
due to rate limiting. This cause instability when deploying 9.x and effects
existing and new builds.

Change-Id: Idb6f8fc2aa42ffb6ec71876e7fbc0114eefc87cc
Closes-Bug: #1423409

commit_message:
Fix static strings with labels for DVR

There are couple of static strings introduced for
DVR configuration such as the L3 agent mode.

This patch would clean up the static strings with
the labels.

Closes-Bug: #1411351
Change-Id: I143262e62ee994e6c01d63e4ea7d5f6292de8286

Added script to move all functional tests to TestRail

This script allows to add the information about
all automated tests in Tempest and all functional
tests in OpenStack projects repositories to TestRail.

commit_message:
Remove nsenter docker image

nsenter via docker container was never properly
implemented for docker with native exec driver.
It can be safely removed.

blueprint fuel-master-docker-upgrade

Change-Id: I5286c60530ea422527024fc099fe877c3962165b

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-03 13:53:25.000000000', 'files': ['docker/module.mk'], 'message': 'Remove docker intermediary containers during build

These containers cannot be deleted safely sometimes
and are not needed, so it is best to purge them
in every case when building docker images.

Closes-Bug: #141578

commit_message:
Remove docker intermediary containers during build

These containers cannot be deleted safely sometimes
and are not needed, so it is best to purge them
in every case when building docker images.

Change-Id: I333685f1e8d21b74ce068dde0b9487adfc4961b7
Closes-Bug: #141578

commit_message:
Add insecure parameter

The following parameter is added

  --insecure

which allows to access swift servers without checking SSL certs
The server’s certificate will not be verified

Change-Id: I2c89986974dcb285293a6480d07e578a52779386
Implements: blueprint allow-insecure-swift-param

commit_message:
Switch nova.api.* to use instance dot notation

nova.compute.manager should use instance objects with the field
access dot notation everywhere. Essentially we use instance.key
instead of instance['key']. Also switch on want_objects=True in
calls to compute_api.get().

Change-Id: Idfdaeb60ecbcc0d8ae082ed471c58868f3d621a8

credentials from resource_setup.

commit_message:
Remove swift monitoring from maas_local playbook

Swift MaaS is setup in the swift_maas.yml playbook, removing the
duplicates from maas_local which were incorrect and unrequired.

Change-Id: I967b7bba387b8ce6994dad5b63c176328395df55
Closes-Bug: #1421665

subject: bug fix:response code 201 in SLO conflict case
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-19 09:02:39.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/middleware/slo.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_slo.py'], 'message': 'bug fix:response code 201 in SLO conflict case

In Swift 2.2.2.post37

One can request PUT with response code "201 Created" a manifest file such as :

[{"path" : "container/segment_object_00", "etag" : "<etag of segment_object_00>", "size_bytes" : <size of segment_object_00>},
{"path" : "container/segment_object_01", "etag" : "<etag of segment_object_01>", "size_bytes" : <size of segment_object_01>},
{"path" : "container/segment_object_02", "etag" : "<etag of segment_object_02>", "size_bytes" : <size of segment_object_02>}]

with command such as :

$curl -X PUT -H 'X-Auth-Token:AUTH_<auth_token>' -H 'Content-Length : <length of manifest>' --upload-file manifest_file http://localhost:8080/v1/AUTH_account/container/segment_object_00?multipart-manifest=put

And when one requests GET SLO with command such as :

$curl -X GET -H 'X-Auth-Token:AUTH_<auth_token>' http://localhost:8080/v1/AUTH_account/container/segment_object_00

, the response code is "409 Conflict".

I think Swift should respond "409 Conflict" when client PUT manifest whose path is included in the manifest.

Change-Id: I29d7cd8d3b9345eb767a1ab590824b5dd2302227
Closes-Bug: 1417936
'}]
commit_message:
bug fix:response code 201 in SLO conflict case

In Swift 2.2.2.post37

One can request PUT with response code "201 Created" a manifest file such as :

[{"path" : "container/segment_object_00", "etag" : "<etag of segment_object_00>", "size_bytes" : <size of segment_object_00>},
{"path" : "container/segment_object_01", "etag" : "<etag of segment_object_01>", "size_bytes" : <size of segment_object_01>},
{"path" : "container/segment_object_02", "etag" : "<etag of segment_object_02>", "size_bytes" : <size of segment_object_02>}]

with command such as :

$curl -X PUT -H 'X-Auth-Token:AUTH_<auth_token>' -H 'Content-Length : <length of manifest>' --upload-file manifest_file http://localhost:8080/v1/AUTH_account/container/segment_object_00?multipart-manifest=put

And when one requests GET SLO with command such as :

$curl -X GET -H 'X-Auth-Token:AUTH_<auth_token>' http://localhost:8080/v1/AUTH_account/container/segment_object_00

, the response code is "409 Conflict".

I think Swift should respond "409 Conflict" when client PUT manifest whose path is included in the manifest.

Change-Id: I29d7cd8d3b9345eb767a1ab590824b5dd2302227
Closes-Bug: 1417936

commit_message:
Update cinder $manage_volume condition for cinder VMDK

$manage_volume condition was improperly checking for the cinder role to
 deploy cinder-volume to. We need to deploy cinder-volume the same way
 as we do for ceph

add host param to cinder backend vmkd as it happens is
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/157004/

Change-Id: I9f615b88f6d22a902ed93f7a6e1eb84803991b34
Closes-Bug: 1410517

commit_message:
Update cinder $manage_volume condition for cinder VMDK

$manage_volume condition was improperly checking for the cinder role to
 deploy cinder-volume to. We need to deploy cinder-volume the same way
 as we do for ceph

add host param to cinder backend vmkd so that duplicate locations can be
 accessed when down, a more comprehensive commit is being proposed upstream
 for the same.

Change-Id: I9f615b88f6d22a902ed93f7a6e1eb84803991b34
Closes-Bug: 1410517

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-02-16 12:48:02.000000000', 'files': ['lib/astute/nodes_remover.rb', 'spec/unit/node_spec.rb', 'spec/unit/nodes_remover_spec.rb', 'lib/astute/node.rb'], 'message': 'Added handling of mclient_remove parameter

If mclient_remove parameter is set to false for a node, it causes mcollective
client not to be called for this node. This is because we want to be able to
forcefuly delete offline nodes and without this parameter Astute keeps
retrying deletion for a long time.
If mclient_remove is not specified for node, it is treated as true by default
thus preserving backwards compatibility.

Implements blueprint: node-removal-task

Change-Id: I256ebdb731a405897192f37b874c6d4f785e3e45
'}]
commit_message:
Added handling of mclient_remove parameter

If mclient_remove parameter is set to false for a node, it causes mcollective
client not to be called for this node. This is because we want to be able to
forcefuly delete offline nodes and without this parameter Astute keeps
retrying deletion for a long time.
If mclient_remove is not specified for node, it is treated as true by default
thus preserving backwards compatibility.

Implements blueprint: node-removal-task

Change-Id: I256ebdb731a405897192f37b874c6d4f785e3e45

commit_message:
Remove misleading message about pids

If puppet failed and pid did not remove,
but actual process already finished
we show message:

    "Looks like expecting puppet and actual are different"

Now we will show it only if we have different between
running actual and pid from file.

Change-Id: I74b3d280329f98fd064a78a91024001a948ef6c1
Related-Bug: #1422364

.. and disable the check locally for two midonet and Ryu classes that
fail since the midonet/ryu libraries are unavailable in our toxenv.

Adding get_agent-loadbalancers policy only because v2 can
reuse the get_loadbalancer-agent policy from v1.
get_loadbalancer-pools doesn't make sense as a policy for
v2 because pools are no longer the root object.

Change-Id: Ic9179ef0a95b91d1b7662537fffeb0a949efc925
"}]
commit_message:
Added policy for lbaas v2 agent extension resource

Adding get_agent-loadbalancers policy only because v2 can
reuse the get_loadbalancer-agent policy from v1.
get_loadbalancer-pools doesn't make sense as a policy for
v2 because pools are no longer the root object.

Change-Id: Ic9179ef0a95b91d1b7662537fffeb0a949efc925

commit_message:
Tweaks to atom documentation

Use links instead of raw docs that don't link to the appropriate
methods. Adjust to say that the retry atoms really provide and
define the strategy to resolve surronding/associated failures.
Add link to what a scope is (in the computer science terms
usage).

Change-Id: I093862c368007ac761cf9d1e3b0f94be36ada13a

commit_message:
Allow loading conductors via entrypoints

Add an easy to use helper function that is exposed to
fetch a conductor in a way that matches how engines
and persistence backends and jobboards are loaded.

This also adjusts the single threaded conductor to
be now named blocking conductor and exposes an entrypoint
backend fetch() function to load current and future
conductors.

Change-Id: Id146d847c329d3e8510a8f24c3ec8b918680ddb5

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-18 17:04:24.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/scenario/utils.py'], 'message': "Handle errors listing flavors and images in scenario utils

This commit adds a try except block around the api calls made during
the scenario tests' testscenario utils module. This is needed because
if a config file is present but has incorrect information the errors
raised will cause import failures during discovery. This will cause
test list (or any other operation which involves test discovery) to
fail.

Change-Id: I8f31abcba547be78fc2dc9250f522bb6ac14cb01
Closes-Bug: #1405797
"}]
commit_message:
Handle errors listing flavors and images in scenario utils

This commit adds a try except block around the api calls made during
the scenario tests' testscenario utils module. This is needed because
if a config file is present but has incorrect information the errors
raised will cause import failures during discovery. This will cause
test list (or any other operation which involves test discovery) to
fail.

Change-Id: I8f31abcba547be78fc2dc9250f522bb6ac14cb01
Closes-Bug: #1405797

commit_message:
Internal notifications for cleanup domain

Use existing domain deleted notification for cleaning up domain
contents in identity rather than cross-manager calls. This
decreases coupling between managers.

bp prefer-notifications

Change-Id: I4adaeeddb50689b46dc4d832b0190748bbc18393

commit_message:
Adds container create/delete integration tests

I have added test_container.py which tests create container
and delete container methods. To do this I have added
containerpage.py with two methods to create and delete
containers. Also added SideBarRegion in basepage.py
which has _click_on_object_store_menu method.

Partially implements blueprint: selenium-integration-testing

Change-Id: Ic5264d388a54e5ac1829e26e046ff049126af2b8

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-18 20:16:50.000000000', 'files': ['elements/vm/finalise.d/51-bootloader'], 'message': "Quote to handle empty DIB_RELEASE

We don't export DIB_RELEASE in the base distro scripts, so many
times it will be an unset variable in 51-bootloader from the vm
element.  Currently that script doesn't handle the situation
properly and we get errors like:

line 160: [: =: unary operator expected

This change quotes the references to DIB_RELEASE so that won't
happen anymore.

Change-Id: Ic8f91804334f8862c217f465be80e96d3116f5c8
"}]
commit_message:
Quote to handle empty DIB_RELEASE

We don't export DIB_RELEASE in the base distro scripts, so many
times it will be an unset variable in 51-bootloader from the vm
element.  Currently that script doesn't handle the situation
properly and we get errors like:

line 160: [: =: unary operator expected

This change quotes the references to DIB_RELEASE so that won't
happen anymore.

Change-Id: Ic8f91804334f8862c217f465be80e96d3116f5c8

commit_message:
Get rid of rpc to fetch fip agent port on agent.

This patch is dependent on the plugin side patch
Change-Id: Ieaa79c8bf2b1e03bc352f9252ce22286703e3715
for retrieving the fip agent port from the
router_update message.

This would reduce the wait time substantially.

Change-Id: I47bc43bab4bff59d14e2cdbce9f8b47826d392d9
Related-Bug: #1415522

[{'number': 38, 'created': '2015-02-19 04:49:12.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/urls.py', 'openstack_dashboard/static_settings.py', 'openstack_dashboard/static/dashboard/scss/serial_console.css', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/tests.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/templates/instances/_detail_console.html', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/templates/instances/serial_console.html', 'openstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.py.example', 'requirements.txt', 'doc/source/topics/settings.rst', 'horizon/static/horizon/js/angular/directives/serialConsole.js', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/console.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/tabs.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/views.py', 'openstack_dashboard/api/nova.py'], 'message': 'Serial Console

Adds support for serial console, in addition to VNC,
SPICE, and RDP.

Depends on term.js being added to OpenStack global
requirements: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/145825

To try this patch:
1. In `nova.conf`:
     [serial_console]
     enable=True
     base_url =
       ws://<location-of-serial-console-proxy>:6083/
2. Set CONSOLE_TYPE = "SERIAL" in local_settings.py.
3. You may need to start nova-serialproxy.
4. You may need to port-forward 6083.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/143615 will make the
serial console available from Network Topology,
along with other consoles.

Co-Authored-By: Richard Jones<r1chardj0n3s@gmail.com>

Implements blueprint serial-console

Change-Id: If83c4efa1a96f9d393110af27f90a0808a23e641
'}]
commit_message:
Serial Console

Adds support for serial console, in addition to VNC,
SPICE, and RDP.

Depends on term.js being added to OpenStack global
requirements: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/145825

To try this patch:
1. In `nova.conf`:
     [serial_console]
     enable=True
     base_url =
       ws://<location-of-serial-console-proxy>:6083/
2. Set CONSOLE_TYPE = "SERIAL" in local_settings.py.
3. You may need to start nova-serialproxy.
4. You may need to port-forward 6083.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/143615 will make the
serial console available from Network Topology,
along with other consoles.

Co-Authored-By: Richard Jones<r1chardj0n3s@gmail.com>

Implements blueprint serial-console

Change-Id: If83c4efa1a96f9d393110af27f90a0808a23e641

Running 'tox -e py27 $some_unit_test' is always failing now
with tox 1.6.0, with this being printed at the beginning:

ERROR: InvocationError: could not find executable 'dsvm-functional:'

Seems commit 540e4d791ff2573aae38810f4c39f2d6f46d8898
(Automate host configuration for functional testing)
added some code to tox.ini that requires version 1.8 or later,
so make that the minimum.

Change-Id: I56313d0a22dbc4007142b8bb4890d1ac8bebff94
"}]
commit_message:
Un-break tox for unit tests

Running 'tox -e py27 $some_unit_test' is always failing now
with tox 1.6.0, with this being printed at the beginning:

ERROR: InvocationError: could not find executable 'dsvm-functional:'

Seems commit 540e4d791ff2573aae38810f4c39f2d6f46d8898
(Automate host configuration for functional testing)
added some code to tox.ini that requires version 1.8 or later,
so make that the minimum.

Change-Id: I56313d0a22dbc4007142b8bb4890d1ac8bebff94

commit_message:
Specification of reference haproxy amphora API

Contains the specification of the initial version of
the haproxy amphora RESTful API. Note that this is likely
to be expanded upon later as amphora lifecycle concerns and
network integration strategy become more concrete.

Implements: bp/appliance-api

Change-Id: Iecc2149c5c89fbdc98a3657f32940b30c8169fdb

commit_message:
Fix sahara install failed at stable/juno branch.

Sahara install failed at stable/juno branch.
The issue is that devstack get sahara master
branch at stable/juno.
Sahara master branch needs of requirements master
branch, however requirements branch is stable/juno.

This patch change sahara master branch to
stable/juno branch in stackrc, and is successed
sahara installation.

Change-Id: I0f9b7a4a04ff316a01065aa19cfdef222fe2ea72
Closes-Bug: #1418289

commit_message:
Hyper-V: Fix retrieving console logs on live migration

Due to a small nit, the VM console log files are not copied properly
during live migration.

This patch fixes the issue, removing as well two unused arguments.

(cherry picked from commit a1fdbca80a1cbd18791c2cbbdd902753a782c38a)

Closes-Bug: #1399127

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/unit/virt/hyperv/test_vmops.py

The signing directory code was scattered around the AuthProtocol
class. To make the AuthProtocol class cleaner, the signing directory
code is pulled into its own class.

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-18 04:16:00.000000000', 'files': ['.testr.conf', 'ironicclient/tests/utils.py'], 'message': "Capture stdout or stderr in tests

This uses the environment variables OS_STDOUT_CAPTURE and
OS_STDERR_CAPTURE to determine whether or not to capture
stdout and stderr (respectively) in the unit tests. These
will appear in the test results for tests that fail.

Capturing will be done if the value is set to one of
(case-insensitive) '1', 't', 'true', 'on', 'y', 'yes'.
Any other value will turn off capturing. The default (via
.testr.conf) is to capture.

Change-Id: I3e6006aa1ed1cf3fad7e55a7201be1c10d165431
Closes-Bug: #1421307
"}]
commit_message:
Capture stdout or stderr in tests

This uses the environment variables OS_STDOUT_CAPTURE and
OS_STDERR_CAPTURE to determine whether or not to capture
stdout and stderr (respectively) in the unit tests. These
will appear in the test results for tests that fail.

Capturing will be done if the value is set to one of
(case-insensitive) '1', 't', 'true', 'on', 'y', 'yes'.
Any other value will turn off capturing. The default (via
.testr.conf) is to capture.

Change-Id: I3e6006aa1ed1cf3fad7e55a7201be1c10d165431
Closes-Bug: #1421307

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-16 04:53:33.000000000', 'files': ['manila/tests/share/drivers/ganesha/test_manager.py', 'etc/manila/rootwrap.d/share.filters', 'manila/share/drivers/ganesha/manager.py'], 'message': "ganesha: fix execute call using invalid argument

An execute call in the ganesha manager module that writes ganesha
export config files is made with 'process_input' argument. This
argument is invalid for processutils's ssh_execute() method which is
used by the execute call to write config files to a remote ganesha
server node. Fix this by not using the 'process_input' argument instead
use other arguments that would still enable the execute call to write
ganesha config files.

Change-Id: I58369468ac7be1de38364a1c1bf6cbf8695b9a1d
Closes-Bug: #1422235
"}]
commit_message:
ganesha: fix execute call using invalid argument

An execute call in the ganesha manager module that writes ganesha
export config files is made with 'process_input' argument. This
argument is invalid for processutils's ssh_execute() method which is
used by the execute call to write config files to a remote ganesha
server node. Fix this by not using the 'process_input' argument instead
use other arguments that would still enable the execute call to write
ganesha config files.

Change-Id: I58369468ac7be1de38364a1c1bf6cbf8695b9a1d
Closes-Bug: #1422235

commit_message:
Adds securitygroup create,edit,delete integration tests

I have added test_securitygroup.py which tests create
securitygroup,edit securitygroup and delete
securitygroup methods. And to allow this I have
added securitygrouppage.py with three methods to create,update
and delete securitygroup. Added accesssecuritypage.py
which has _click_on_secgroup_link method. Modified projectpage.py
which has go_to_accesssecurity_page method.

Partially implements blueprint: selenium-integration-testing

Change-Id: Ic16c0bd21c6cb4026c2402d046f9fa1f47af0c55

Add qemu-utils to n-cpu debs

Qemu-utils is needed by nova-cpu, we are hitting issues with this in
multi node testing where fewer services are installed on the second
node.

commit_message:
Check if routing rule exists before adding

Since there is no equivalent to 'ip route replace...' with
'ip rule...', we need to check the existence first before
adding, as otherwise we'll end up with multiple identical
routing rules.

Change-Id: I8f1f2424dd854fad8a72478463fa8fadd6a5c168
Closes-Bug: #1398865

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-17 00:10:00.000000000', 'files': ['upgrade-ironic'], 'message': 'Also restart nova-api as part of nova-bm -> ironic migration

The nova-api service needs a restart after the migration to pick up the new
compute_driver config setting.  This toggles whether baremetal node requests
are proxied to ironic or served locally from the nova-bm database.  A new
test was added to tempest that stresses this and is failing the juno grenade
job because the API is attempting to serve nodes locally instead of via
Ironic.

Change-Id: I4f8354abfd909ba4acd62d3ce4a6ab0535a64f7c
Closes-bug: #1422520
'}]
commit_message:
Also restart nova-api as part of nova-bm -> ironic migration

The nova-api service needs a restart after the migration to pick up the new
compute_driver config setting.  This toggles whether baremetal node requests
are proxied to ironic or served locally from the nova-bm database.  A new
test was added to tempest that stresses this and is failing the juno grenade
job because the API is attempting to serve nodes locally instead of via
Ironic.

Change-Id: I4f8354abfd909ba4acd62d3ce4a6ab0535a64f7c
Closes-bug: #1422520

description field for cluster will be updated with
exception message

* Moved heat template resources from 'resources' to
  'service/heat/resources'
* Separated tests for heat templates and heat client.

Change-Id: I4c7a561f1648f34e71574a556cbc07ed2cf9b173
Closes-Bug: #1373075"}]
commit_message:
Reorganized heat template generation code

* Extracted heat template generation from
  'utils/openstack/heat.py' to 'service/heat/templates.py'.
  Now heat.py is for heat client only.
* Moved heat template resources from 'resources' to
  'service/heat/resources'
* Separated tests for heat templates and heat client.

Change-Id: I4c7a561f1648f34e71574a556cbc07ed2cf9b173
Closes-Bug: #1373075

commit_message:
Remove root_helper arg from AsyncProcess

Removes the root_helper arg from AsyncProcess and areas whose use
of root_helper was soley for passing it to AsyncProcess.

Change-Id: I6c34f2d8466444c82f8712a2a765975695795fd7
Partially-Implements: rootwrap-daemon-mode

commit_message:
Implementation of Brocade Vyatta VPNaaS Plugin

Introducing new service-driver and device-driver for Vyatta vRouter.
with portions of vRouter parsing code hosted in stackforge/networking-brocade
repo.

Change-Id: I6028283c86849196170ada8b5ebeb1efe4e38ea4
Implements: blueprint brocade-vyatta-vpnaas-plugin

commit_message:
Disable file injection when using RBD as compute ephemeral storage

When using Ceph/RBD as ephemeral storage for Nova compute, it is
recommended by Inktank to disable file injection.
See: http://ceph.com/docs/next/rbd/rbd-openstack/

Change-Id: I73e016e861ef8b0aead840fa7c519f58068074df
(cherry picked from commit f0227c71b1b9694560fcf845fa2b47d4eeee8b05)

commit_message:
Adding portdb and fastpath_flood to n1kv.conf

Also need to remove installing explicit installation of openvswitch
and call vswitch::ovs instead.
Adding testcases to neutron_agents_n1kv_vem_spec.rb and fixing an
error in neutron_plugins_ml2_spec.rb

Change-Id: I2b4ada801610d7081ac3e2469bcacd6ea5ec8e7d
Closes-Bug: 1421449

subject: Fix if check in neutron lib forward testing definition
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4146, 'name': 'Clark Boylan', 'email': 'cboylan@sapwetik.org', 'username': 'cboylan'}, {'_account_id': 7069, 'name': 'Joshua Hesketh', 'email': 'josh@nitrotech.org', 'username': 'jhesketh'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-19 02:22:52.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/devstack-gate.yaml'], 'message': "Fix if check in neutron lib forward testing definition

This commit adds missing space to the if condition for detecting
whether the job is on icehouse or not. Without this the check fails
with an error like:

   /tmp/hudson6963778358651597131.sh: line 8: [: missing `]'

which causes all of the forward testing jobs to run the incomplete
set of tests.

Change-Id: Id577a4943864f431c8e5e4b8dbdfcb8d59f125aa
"}]
commit_message:
Fix if check in neutron lib forward testing definition

This commit adds missing space to the if condition for detecting
whether the job is on icehouse or not. Without this the check fails
with an error like:

   /tmp/hudson6963778358651597131.sh: line 8: [: missing `]'

which causes all of the forward testing jobs to run the incomplete
set of tests.

Change-Id: Id577a4943864f431c8e5e4b8dbdfcb8d59f125aa

commit_message:
Remove root_helper arg from SecurityGroupAgentRpc

Removes the root_helper argument from SecurityGroupAgentRpc and
removes usages of root_helper that were solely required for it.

Change-Id: If166fda9fac7718ae7bbc86756884ddea8dd70d5
Partially-Implements: blueprint rootwrap-daemon-mode

commit_message:
Moved several services into neutron.cmd.eventlet

- dhcp-agent
- l3-agent
- metadata-agent
- metadata-proxy
- metering-agent
- server

This allows us to remove explicit monkey_patch() call.

Also removed ability to execute neutron-server avoiding a corresponding
entry point.

Depends-On: I2d7081dbd4cb532332e3b66667bb8c71aa5a6658

Related-Bug: #1418541
Change-Id: I89e3e8e23374ab1a9a1844b3caaa88e162418546

commit_message:
Add admin_workers and public_workers configuration options

Juno Keystone adds admin_workers and public_workers configuration
options to control the number of admin and public wsgi worker
processes.

This patch adds support for setting those options.

Change-Id: I16d08321aedb7bac502052e1e1fc7fd9728e2168

commit_message:
Tweak mocking logic for L3 plugin tests

I stumbled upon this and I was baffled as to why the rpc notifier
was being mocked up the way it was. I think this calls for some
sanity-checking and this patch attempts to bring some common sense
in the test, or I could be barking up at wrong tree...woof woof

Change-Id: I57cf2d6a18ce37ef65fbf9d87d6de70c0178c6ca

commit_message:
Glance Rest API for Angular Front End

This is the glance direct / non-abstracted rest API
for the angular front end.

This initial patch will only implement the APIs needed to
support the launch instance work.

This was refactored out of change: 141273
All v1 / v2 work is being done separately in change: 150084

Based on the work done for Keystone here:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/150636

Partially Implements: blueprint launch-instance-redesign
Co-Authored-By: Richard Jones <r1chardj0n3s@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I28735e242d610235695b1070a15f739e0d50b696

Don't rely on l3_agent entry point in neutron to do it for the agent.

There are plans [1] to move eventlet monkey patching into a separate
location other than neutron.agent.l3_agent. That means we won't be able
to rely on base l3_agent module to be monkey patched for us.

This patch mimics the tree structure used in neutron to keep eventlet
patched services in single place. Even though there is only one agent in
tree that needs monkey patching, it's better to keep things uniformly
with neutron, and allow to introduce more agents later without
explicitly adding another call to monkey_patch() for those.

[1]: I2bc16ca4422c01d64e9fac4910214dbb0d0326ff

Change-Id: I2d7081dbd4cb532332e3b66667bb8c71aa5a6658
"}]
commit_message:
Explicitly monkey patch VPN agent

Don't rely on l3_agent entry point in neutron to do it for the agent.

There are plans [1] to move eventlet monkey patching into a separate
location other than neutron.agent.l3_agent. That means we won't be able
to rely on base l3_agent module to be monkey patched for us.

This patch mimics the tree structure used in neutron to keep eventlet
patched services in single place. Even though there is only one agent in
tree that needs monkey patching, it's better to keep things uniformly
with neutron, and allow to introduce more agents later without
explicitly adding another call to monkey_patch() for those.

[1]: I2bc16ca4422c01d64e9fac4910214dbb0d0326ff

Change-Id: I2d7081dbd4cb532332e3b66667bb8c71aa5a6658

2nd time the router was configured on new agent,

'}]
commit_message:
Add a functional test that checks HA router is configured on a restarted agent

Functional test should  validate the expected behavior of patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/148335/.

That test would pass if keepalived received the SIGHUP signal the
2nd time the router was configured on new agent,
and it would fail otherwise.

Closes-bug: #1413684

Change-Id: Iaa72402920cd0854e1738e7de87b8cba46ecd9f9

commit_message:
Enable CentOS base images

This patch builds images in the /tmp/$secure_name directory.  This is
because docker cannot package builds from outside the CWD.

This temporarily breaks fedora until the next patch which fixes it.
Unfortunately this is a git/patch problem which can't handle a rename
and link of the same source file in one commit.

Change-Id: I70653565a51d40084dd234f432c2572ad92c1051

commit_message:
Move the links down one level for all of the build scripts

The build scripts in the directories of each docker build at present
do not link to the proper build scripts.  Correct that problem by
linking them in the correct location.

Change-Id: I328a0733e3dbd842c379982d4118cec8ccc220ef
