commit_message:
Prepare for multi-base image support in Kolla

Some folks may prefer images which move faster (Fedora) or images which
have a longer lifecycle (CentOS).  Allow the user to choose which images
they want by making docker containers for both types of base operating
systems.

Change-Id: I23aad7cebfe88676f5662e5ec8aaaccbaea43d52

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-02-18 12:37:10.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/__init__.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/linux/simple_daemon.py'], 'message': "tests: monkey patch stdlib before importing other modules

Some oslo libraries assume that stdlib is already patched when they are
imported (f.e. oslo.concurrency.processutils currently checks whether
time module is monkey patched on import to detect which subprocess
module should be used).

For services, we achieve this by moving monkey_patch() calls as high in
import list as possible. But for tests, we don't control the order in
which testr loads test cases. So to be on safe side, we should make sure
any attempt to load a test case from the tree results in eventlet patch.

We can't put the monkey_patch() call into e.g. neutron/__init__.py to
reuse it both for tests and for services, because in that case we may
break flake8 that loads hacking checks from neutron.* namespace and
relies on proper (unpatched) subprocess module.

Closes-Bug: #1418541
Change-Id: Id58409000d0e086f3fb664a15935af4f1708c396
"}]
commit_message:
tests: monkey patch stdlib before importing other modules

Some oslo libraries assume that stdlib is already patched when they are
imported (f.e. oslo.concurrency.processutils currently checks whether
time module is monkey patched on import to detect which subprocess
module should be used).

For services, we achieve this by moving monkey_patch() calls as high in
import list as possible. But for tests, we don't control the order in
which testr loads test cases. So to be on safe side, we should make sure
any attempt to load a test case from the tree results in eventlet patch.

We can't put the monkey_patch() call into e.g. neutron/__init__.py to
reuse it both for tests and for services, because in that case we may
break flake8 that loads hacking checks from neutron.* namespace and
relies on proper (unpatched) subprocess module.

Closes-Bug: #1418541
Change-Id: Id58409000d0e086f3fb664a15935af4f1708c396

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-01-19 05:42:06.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/scenario/test_security_groups_basic_ops.py'], 'message': 'Test multiple security groups association for a vm

 - This testcase makes use of access point VM,which is created in setUp()
   method
 - access point vm is already created with two security groups i.e
   access_sg & def_sg .The access_sg security group is added with ssh rule
 - In the test case I make use of this and only add a security rule to
   already added security group def_sg (which was without any rule)
 - The Intent of this testcase is to test that both the security groups (
   each with a single security rule )are applied .

Change-Id: I8e806056bc6197a3189e827c0b182b7c4bdbdf41
'}]
commit_message:
Test multiple security groups association for a vm

 - This testcase makes use of access point VM,which is created in setUp()
   method
 - access point vm is already created with two security groups i.e
   access_sg & def_sg .The access_sg security group is added with ssh rule
 - In the test case I make use of this and only add a security rule to
   already added security group def_sg (which was without any rule)
 - The Intent of this testcase is to test that both the security groups (
   each with a single security rule )are applied .

Change-Id: I8e806056bc6197a3189e827c0b182b7c4bdbdf41

commit_message:
Remove CONF values from identity clients

To move identity clients to tempest-lib, this patch moves
CONF values from identity clients to the client setting and classes
instantiate identity clients.

Change-Id: I441c9dd5aa7f02f69ecf577cfaea379f1fa6158b

commit_message:
Consistently use oslo_config.cfg.CONF

Keystone modules used different sources of the CONF global so were
inconsistent. All modules should use CONF from oslo_config.cfg.

Change-Id: I60c8d2c577d37b9b8a367b46596154ce6c49fff4

commit_message:
Cinder: Wait for volume to be 'available' before attaching

VolumesV2ActionsTest creates a volume in resource_setup() but doesn't wait
before attempting a volume attach operation (in the `test_*` methods)

Change-Id: Ic205f1e2ff6902b2e55fe3fccedd6ce1547efb98
Closes-Bug: #1422308

There is no reason to monkey patch the tool (it does not rely on any
special kind of model of concurrency). It's better to avoid eventlet
wherever possible, and there are discussions on whether we want to start
dropping eventlet usage agent by agent, so it's worth keeping as much of
code out of monkey business.

Related-Bug: #1418541
Change-Id: I1c1bb5a23e191da660efe9d4179ffaf5fec647f9
"}]
commit_message:
Don't monkey patch netns_cleanup

There is no reason to monkey patch the tool (it does not rely on any
special kind of model of concurrency). It's better to avoid eventlet
wherever possible, and there are discussions on whether we want to start
dropping eventlet usage agent by agent, so it's worth keeping as much of
code out of monkey business.

Related-Bug: #1418541
Change-Id: I1c1bb5a23e191da660efe9d4179ffaf5fec647f9

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-18 12:37:10.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/cmd/eventlet/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Monkey patch all the code inside neutron/cmd/eventlet/...

The directory is initially empty.

We are going to maintain entry points for all services and agents that
run in eventlet mode in this directory, and monkey patch them from
there, instead of spreading monkey_patch() calls throughout the library.

This will guarantee us that all the services that are maintained in this
part of the tree monkey patch stdlib properly, before doing any other
imports.

This is also useful to track which parts of the project require
eventlet.  This will later help to migrate services one by one out of
eventlet to real threads in case we decide to move this direction.

Related-Bug: #1417386
Related-Bug: #1418541
Change-Id: I2bc16ca4422c01d64e9fac4910214dbb0d0326ff
'}]
commit_message:
Monkey patch all the code inside neutron/cmd/eventlet/...

The directory is initially empty.

We are going to maintain entry points for all services and agents that
run in eventlet mode in this directory, and monkey patch them from
there, instead of spreading monkey_patch() calls throughout the library.

This will guarantee us that all the services that are maintained in this
part of the tree monkey patch stdlib properly, before doing any other
imports.

This is also useful to track which parts of the project require
eventlet.  This will later help to migrate services one by one out of
eventlet to real threads in case we decide to move this direction.

Related-Bug: #1417386
Related-Bug: #1418541
Change-Id: I2bc16ca4422c01d64e9fac4910214dbb0d0326ff

subject: Summarize expected failures
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 5803, 'name': 'Attila Fazekas', 'email': 'afazekas@redhat.com', 'username': 'afazekas'}, {'_account_id': 11564, 'name': 'Chris Dent', 'email': 'cdent@anticdent.org', 'username': 'chdent'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-16 15:59:29.000000000', 'files': ['tempest_lib/cmd/subunit_trace.py'], 'message': 'Summarize expected failures

The incoming stream has the xfail data but count_tests was not
matching on the xfail status. Instead it was matching on the
fragment 'fail' meaning that expected failures were counted as
such. By bounding the regular expressions it is possible to get more
specific results will still leaving the count_tests method flexible
for other users where fragments would be useful.

Counts of 'uxsuccess' are also summarized as "Unexpected Success".

It's unclear how to effectively automate testing of this. Manual
testing returns the expected results.

Change-Id: I5b1458f9a98712ea3e424d2c9610b915055138af
'}]
commit_message:
Summarize expected failures

The incoming stream has the xfail data but count_tests was not
matching on the xfail status. Instead it was matching on the
fragment 'fail' meaning that expected failures were counted as
such. By bounding the regular expressions it is possible to get more
specific results will still leaving the count_tests method flexible
for other users where fragments would be useful.

Counts of 'uxsuccess' are also summarized as "Unexpected Success".

It's unclear how to effectively automate testing of this. Manual
testing returns the expected results.

Change-Id: I5b1458f9a98712ea3e424d2c9610b915055138af

commit_message:
Check for invalid filtering on v3/role_assignments

HTTP 400 is returned for invalid filters:
- domain and project
- user and group
- effective and group
- effective, domain and inherited

Closes-Bug: 1406667

Change-Id: Iac64856424a80935d34631e2243da4fc329ab2a0

commit_message:
Change the default scsi controller to virtio-scsi

Change the scsi controller model from the default qemu target to
virtio-scsi which has better performance while retaining compatibility
with the scsi target.

Change-Id: I1a0422bf8052407ddd118b60005a33c90d1ddb66

commit_message:
Deletes duplicated information on plug-ins from main docs

Currently, information on plug-ins is duplicated
in several sources: Plugin Catalog, User Guide and Fuel Plug-in
Guide.

To provide a single entry point, I suggest removing
instructions on specific plug-ins from User and Plug-in Guide with
leaving common information only.

Change-Id: I9f950e9afc180377d050545033bbaf9aef4aef80
(cherry picked from commit aa395654b477e7f295cca984317cdca9d62e3814)

commit_message:
Fixed nested lists in container spec

The container spec file had a couple places were nested
lists were used which didn't have the necessary blank
lines before and after.  As such, they didn not render
to HTML correctly.

Change-Id: I5d17644facdc25ec30db563c217367672529b8e1

revisions:
[{'number': 16, 'created': '2015-02-18 02:50:49.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/test_emc_vnxdirect.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/emc/emc_cli_iscsi.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/emc/emc_cli_fc.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/emc/emc_vnx_cli.py'], 'message': 'Pool-aware scheduler support in EMC VNX Cinder driver

Changed EMC VNX driver to report pools information in
update_volume_stats and removed the original pool selection
logic in VNX driver.
Besides, deprecated the VNX driver defined extra spec key
"storagetype:pool", since "pool_name" key is introduced by
the pool-aware scheduler feature to specify which pool to
place the volume.

Change-Id: Idd2b0008a3844ad9db72768e6016c63e7e4c5e98
Implements: blueprint pool-aware-cinder-scheduler-vnx
'}]
commit_message:
Pool-aware scheduler support in EMC VNX Cinder driver

Changed EMC VNX driver to report pools information in
update_volume_stats and removed the original pool selection
logic in VNX driver.
Besides, deprecated the VNX driver defined extra spec key
"storagetype:pool", since "pool_name" key is introduced by
the pool-aware scheduler feature to specify which pool to
place the volume.

Change-Id: Idd2b0008a3844ad9db72768e6016c63e7e4c5e98
Implements: blueprint pool-aware-cinder-scheduler-vnx

According to the format of /etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini

commit_message:
Fix ml2_conf.ini settings

According to the format of /etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini
the following parameter

  [ovs]
  network_vlan_ranges = physnet1

should be

  [ml2_type_vlan]
  network_vlan_ranges = physnet1

Change-Id: I81c9d273b96b82c3c37aa5f8512f7b3bd671d8b5

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-02-10 15:13:06.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/hyperv/test_hypervapi.py', 'nova/virt/fake.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/xenapi/test_xenapi.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/vmwareapi/test_driver_api.py', 'nova/virt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py', 'nova/virt/hyperv/driver.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/virt/xenapi/driver.py', 'nova/virt/vmwareapi/driver.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/test_virt_drivers.py'], 'message': 'Fix detach_sriov_ports to get context to be able to get image metadata

The previous implementation took the context using
get_admin_context() which return context with admin flag set,
but all the other attributes are None.
This is not sufficient to get image metadata,
it is need context with elevated permission.
The change here is to update API to pass the context to suspend so
it will be able to pass it to detach_sriov_ports.
Also update the snapshot method to pass context to detach_sriov_ports

Closes-Bug:#1406486

Change-Id: I4757a7646d7bee66db03c5d2410de7378c039d41
'}]
commit_message:
Fix detach_sriov_ports to get context to be able to get image metadata

The previous implementation took the context using
get_admin_context() which return context with admin flag set,
but all the other attributes are None.
This is not sufficient to get image metadata,
it is need context with elevated permission.
The change here is to update API to pass the context to suspend so
it will be able to pass it to detach_sriov_ports.
Also update the snapshot method to pass context to detach_sriov_ports

Closes-Bug:#1406486

Change-Id: I4757a7646d7bee66db03c5d2410de7378c039d41

So, the database retrieval done in the secret and order controllers

authentication, even though that part is executed before the RBAC

Change-Id: Ic9ef34f53db069210cef0ebb7c42286dd14720ec

commit_message:
Add clarification regarding _lookup in secrets and orders

So, the database retrieval done in the secret and order controllers
doesn't make it fully clear that it actually takes place after
authentication, even though that part is executed before the RBAC
policy check is made. This change attempts to clarify what's going on.

Change-Id: Ic9ef34f53db069210cef0ebb7c42286dd14720ec

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-02-18 20:39:12.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/api/controllers/orders.py', 'barbican/common/exception.py', 'barbican/api/controllers/secrets.py', 'barbican/api/controllers/__init__.py', 'barbican/tests/api/test_resources.py'], 'message': "Enforce secret and order IDs are valid UUIDs

The following CR will enforce a verification of the ID passed from the
URI to make sure that it's actually a valid UUID. So it wouldn't even
do a lookup to the database if the id is not valid.

Now, for testing purposes, I mock the call to the aforementioned
validation. This is because it's preferable to have human readable IDs
while testing instead of UUIDs, since this eases debugging.

Change-Id: I0e0231f2587324ccbc40e98d1b69254beb9a6eb3
"}]
commit_message:
Enforce secret and order IDs are valid UUIDs

The following CR will enforce a verification of the ID passed from the
URI to make sure that it's actually a valid UUID. So it wouldn't even
do a lookup to the database if the id is not valid.

Now, for testing purposes, I mock the call to the aforementioned
validation. This is because it's preferable to have human readable IDs
while testing instead of UUIDs, since this eases debugging.

Change-Id: I0e0231f2587324ccbc40e98d1b69254beb9a6eb3

revisions. This is different than the more detailed history section

commit_message:
Create heat template for docker-swarm bay

This template will spin up a single swarm-manager node and N number of
swarm-agent nodes. Every node, including the manager, is running a
Docker daemon and a swarm-agent service advertising the docker daemon.
The swarm-manager node is running an additional swarm-manager service
listening on port 2376. The swarm-manager service acts a a single
docker api for interacting with the entire cluster.

This template was adapted from the existing heat-kubernetes bay template.
As such, it uses identical neutron network topology.

Implements: blueprint docker-bay-heat-template

Change-Id: I22276022bbb4155ccdce0f75c47d46492a5ac821

is_keystone_enabled() was calling is_service_enabled(), which is what called
is_keystone_enabled() in the first place.  Make it work as designed and

commit_message:
Fix is_keystone_enabled()

is_keystone_enabled() was calling is_service_enabled(), which is what called
is_keystone_enabled() in the first place.  Make it work as designed and
also change calls to use the full service name.  Note that this is all
still comptible with the prior usage of 'is_service_enabled key'.

Change-Id: I9c28377ecf074b7996461d2a4ca12d88dfc4d47e

commit_message:
Teach pip_install() about virtual envs

Set PIP_VIRTUAL_ENV to install the package(s) into an existing virtual
environment.  This works by simply using the pip command already
in the venv, and not using sudo.

Change-Id: I910e1752e58a666174f83b4f97e547851e66e655

commit_message:
Fix extraneous comma that breaks docbook generation

There is a stray comma in the middle of the help section that changes
the string to a tuple, causing docbook to fail with:

   td.text = "(%s) %s" % (type(option).__name__, option.help.strip())
AttributeError: 'tuple' object has no attribute 'strip'

Change-Id: I8f03801fe5463548e3bba1b13e0370fd30ac9927

commit_message:
Create server requires *Ref names during POST

The compute service expects imageRef and flavorRef in the request body,
so combined with change 156101 to store values in resource.prop as
they're named, this change allows Server.create to work properly when
constructed from its props. Previously it was sending the values as
image and flavor.

Moving image to being an alias allows everything else to work as
expected.

Change-Id: I3705149d7f5396152c98e4e78fb7c68518db1efc

subject: Prefer storing prop values as their name
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8257, 'name': 'Brian Curtin', 'email': 'brian@python.org', 'username': 'briancurtin'}, {'_account_id': 8736, 'name': 'Terry Howe', 'email': 'terrylhowe@gmail.com', 'username': 'terrylhowe'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-18 20:31:32.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/resource.py', 'openstack/tests/test_resource.py'], 'message': 'Prefer storing prop values as their name

When a resource.prop is named the same as its alias, the Resource
initializer inserts an entry with that alias name into its
_attrs dictionary, and then it attempts to call setattr using
that same name, which is also the name of the resource.prop. When this
happens, _attrs has a key for the `alias` and it then tries to add an
entry for the `name` of the prop. Since this is happening in a loop
around the _attrs dictionary, it causes the dictionary to increase in
size, which causes a RuntimeError. Here's an example that would cause
this to occur.

    attr = resource.prop("something", alias="attr")

If we prefer to always store the value under the `name`, in this case,
something, we won't ever attempt to mutate the dictionary while setting
props.

A slightly similar issue came up before, where a response body
contained the exact name of a prop which had a different name, so
the same mutation during __set__ was occurring.

Change-Id: Iee5c1f050c9bfcfc5afa8bbf77df7e1db02564d3
Related-Bug: 1414089
'}]
commit_message:
Prefer storing prop values as their name

When a resource.prop is named the same as its alias, the Resource
initializer inserts an entry with that alias name into its
_attrs dictionary, and then it attempts to call setattr using
that same name, which is also the name of the resource.prop. When this
happens, _attrs has a key for the `alias` and it then tries to add an
entry for the `name` of the prop. Since this is happening in a loop
around the _attrs dictionary, it causes the dictionary to increase in
size, which causes a RuntimeError. Here's an example that would cause
this to occur.

    attr = resource.prop("something", alias="attr")

If we prefer to always store the value under the `name`, in this case,
something, we won't ever attempt to mutate the dictionary while setting
props.

A slightly similar issue came up before, where a response body
contained the exact name of a prop which had a different name, so
the same mutation during __set__ was occurring.

Change-Id: Iee5c1f050c9bfcfc5afa8bbf77df7e1db02564d3
Related-Bug: 1414089

commit_message:
Prevent leaking internal details out via exceptions

When lower level exceptions occur, return a generic
message in the response to clients to prevent leaking
internal information outside. Added unit tests
for FaultWrapper. Added integration tests to check
responses to API calls when exception occur.

Change-Id: I63b214e427a0d7483b4421398aa9dd3371ffe0a0
Closes-Bug: #1415404

commit_message:
add retry logic to is_block_device function

In testing the os.stat command was throwing a unhandled exception.
This Patch adds a try block around the os.stat command and if unable
to execute with out error in "CONF.deploy.iscsi_verify_attempts"
it rasies InstanceDeployFailure

Change-Id: Ibf5483435b02fab64bd4f0d368326b9ecbb4cc07
Closes-bug: #1417307

VPNaaS Enable coverage testing for functional tests

Added the ability to run 'tox -e dsvm-functional-cover' to get coverage
testing for dsvm-functional tests in tests/functional/. Also, removed
lockutils-wrapper, as is not needed (from testing seen so far).

subject: Support Resource as a type for properties
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8257, 'name': 'Brian Curtin', 'email': 'brian@python.org', 'username': 'briancurtin'}, {'_account_id': 8736, 'name': 'Terry Howe', 'email': 'terrylhowe@gmail.com', 'username': 'terrylhowe'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-02-18 03:28:18.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/resource.py', 'openstack/tests/test_resource.py'], 'message': 'Support Resource as a type for properties

Currently we only support built-in types, but given that we send and
receive IDs which correspond to Resource types we have, this adds a case
that knows how to work with Resource and its subclasses. This allows us
to work with Resource objects in the most simple case of being returned
an ID, but also allows us to build more complex Resources, such as the
Limits resource in Compute v2.

Change-Id: Ib3c0634e4f750f44efe2a74eb00cc4c1ad8d2a5d
'}]
commit_message:
Support Resource as a type for properties

Currently we only support built-in types, but given that we send and
receive IDs which correspond to Resource types we have, this adds a case
that knows how to work with Resource and its subclasses. This allows us
to work with Resource objects in the most simple case of being returned
an ID, but also allows us to build more complex Resources, such as the
Limits resource in Compute v2.

Change-Id: Ib3c0634e4f750f44efe2a74eb00cc4c1ad8d2a5d

subject: Clean up configuration option management
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 6482, 'name': 'Steve Martinelli', 'email': 's.martinelli@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevemar'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-18 17:47:01.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/api.rst', 'oslo_policy/opts.py', 'oslo_policy/policy.py', 'oslo_policy/tests/test_opts.py'], 'message': 'Clean up configuration option management

Move the option definitions into the opts module with the other
functions related to options.

Add set_defaults() to override the default settings for options and make
it part of the public API of the library by including it in the
documentation.

Add opts._register() so the options can be registered consistently from
multiple places.

Change-Id: Ib74beac58a07bf5ee0f92c2b7eda8281ef7d7c33
'}]
commit_message:
Clean up configuration option management

Move the option definitions into the opts module with the other
functions related to options.

Add set_defaults() to override the default settings for options and make
it part of the public API of the library by including it in the
documentation.

Add opts._register() so the options can be registered consistently from
multiple places.

Change-Id: Ib74beac58a07bf5ee0f92c2b7eda8281ef7d7c33

subject: Set umask to 0022 for OCF scripts that add network namespaces
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8787, 'name': 'Dmitry Borodaenko', 'email': 'angdraug@gmail.com', 'username': 'angdraug'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-17 11:22:36.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/cluster/files/ns_IPaddr2', 'deployment/puppet/cluster/files/ns_haproxy'], 'message': 'Set umask to 0022 for OCF scripts that add network namespaces

When ns_haproxy or ns_IPaddr2 create the first network namespace
/var/run/netns will have permissions of 751 due to the umask
being 0026 at that time. This will cause the problems with
Neutron agents described in the referenced bug.

Change-Id: Ib8d1f485272ef843e935f43b1b40d7db6b0c2e78
Closes-bug: #1414239
'}]
commit_message:
Set umask to 0022 for OCF scripts that add network namespaces

When ns_haproxy or ns_IPaddr2 create the first network namespace
/var/run/netns will have permissions of 751 due to the umask
being 0026 at that time. This will cause the problems with
Neutron agents described in the referenced bug.

Change-Id: Ib8d1f485272ef843e935f43b1b40d7db6b0c2e78
Closes-bug: #1414239

commit_message:
Use stack.validate() not stack.create() for limit tests

Now that stack_resource validate recursively we don't need
to actually create the stack in order to test for limit checking.

part of blueprint decouple-nested

commit_message:
Remove some unused exceptions from Cinder

This patch removes some unused exceptions that came along
with the export from Cinder.  Since os-brick doesn't include
target side code, we remove the target associated exceptions.

Change-Id: I0096e76f958e04829b98d5c4c47f49c82b58d8aa

commit_message:
Revert "Move deployment handle_signal to rpc call"

This reverts commit a63f634bfb802c03631b42de4b65e21acc4422b5.

This commit caused a regression in tripleo-ci whith a database
"Incorrect datetime value" error.

Change-Id: I55f9be8ffb319edb56371d8d370d58d02bdf3867
Closes-Bug: #1423126

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-18 15:30:17.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/volume.py'], 'message': "extract method from fc volume discovery

Looking at the s390 fc support patch, this function seemed overly
nested. I think it's better if we isolate the matrix computation
first, so that when we are doing real work we're looping over 1 pre
computed set of device tuples, instead of multiple nested for loops.

Change-Id: Ic5111c76cc976a873a6a816ac7163ab8dd4579a1
"}]
commit_message:
extract method from fc volume discovery

Looking at the s390 fc support patch, this function seemed overly
nested. I think it's better if we isolate the matrix computation
first, so that when we are doing real work we're looping over 1 pre
computed set of device tuples, instead of multiple nested for loops.

Change-Id: Ic5111c76cc976a873a6a816ac7163ab8dd4579a1

commit_message:
start recording error notifications

projects (specifically nova) send notifications on error topic when
an error occurs. we should capture this in events.

Closes-Bug: #1364708

commit_message:
Better check for integer range to account for 0

We should be using "if value is not None" to better check
for the condition where the value is 0 and 0 is not in the
valid range.

Co-Authored-By: Longjie_Cao <grasson1101@aliyun.com>
Closes-Bug: #1416212
Change-Id: Ie5c81f1916e301619955364b040bdc7a9275e29c

commit_message:
Added secret_type to Secret model

Added a secret_type column to the Secret model class. The secret_type column
indicates the type of secret that is being stored. It must be one of the values
from the SecretType values defined in the secret_store module.

Added new secret type definitons. A secret can now be one of symmertric,
public, private, certificate, passphrase, or opaque. The opaque data type
represents data that is secret and its encoding and format are unknown.

Added migration script for adding the secret type column. The secret_type
column is added and all existing rows have their secret_type set to opaque.

Change-Id: Ic349781a95e50e41c9f24f468e71f93935e55fdb
Implements: blueprint content-types
UpgradeImpact: adds a new column for secret_type in secrets table
Also-By: Kaitlin Farr <kaitlin.farr@jhuapl.edu>

commit_message:
Reduce page title duplication in Adv net services

reducing duplication of page title logic, this patch applies that change
to the project firewalls, loadbalancers and vpn views.

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-18 16:45:20.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/tests/gabbi/fixtures.py', 'gnocchi/tests/base.py', 'gnocchi/tests/gabbi/__init__.py', 'test-requirements.txt', '.testr.conf', 'gnocchi/tests/gabbi/gabbits/base.yaml', 'gnocchi/tests/gabbi/test_gabbi.py', 'test-requirements-py3.txt', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Base infrastructure to support gabbi tests

Provides the code necessary to run gabbi tests hosted in yaml files
in gnocchi/tests/gabbi/gabbits. The provided tests do very little
other than prove that it is working. Subsequent patches may add
more rigorous and vigorous tests by adding yaml files.

The gabbi tests are either run as part of other tox targets that
include a database, or by a 'py27-gabbi' target. If no indexer is
available, those gabbi tests which require the ConfigFixture (all
of them because of the way the api server starts up) will be skipped.

Change-Id: I9fece3b608847177ab30cff082ecee0d33e34cc5
"}]
commit_message:
Base infrastructure to support gabbi tests

Provides the code necessary to run gabbi tests hosted in yaml files
in gnocchi/tests/gabbi/gabbits. The provided tests do very little
other than prove that it is working. Subsequent patches may add
more rigorous and vigorous tests by adding yaml files.

The gabbi tests are either run as part of other tox targets that
include a database, or by a 'py27-gabbi' target. If no indexer is
available, those gabbi tests which require the ConfigFixture (all
of them because of the way the api server starts up) will be skipped.

Change-Id: I9fece3b608847177ab30cff082ecee0d33e34cc5

commit_message:
Docker image cleanup on failed unit tests

When an assembly's unit tests fails, the docker image is not
cleaned up, which takes up disk space on the worker node.

Change-Id: I241b479335fa21509200a22bd7ba46ce21f3b97e
Closes-bug: 1421319

commit_message:
Refactored vmware class for multi HV

* Refactored vmware class for multi hv support
* Older functionality has beeh saved because UI part is not completed
* Added new erb's templates
* Added new resources for multi hv support
* Added "if" cases for supporting new and old features
* Added corresponding tasks
* Removed simple mode support

Change-Id: I181caf3dc76f5a511461067322fc6129ef47f59f
Implements: blueprint vmware-dual-hypervisor

subject: tests: fix handling of TIMEOUT_SCALING_FACTOR
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 7491, 'name': 'Viktor Serhieiev', 'email': 'viktor.sergeyev@gmail.com', 'username': 'vsergeyev'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-12 12:44:32.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/db/test_migrations.py'], 'message': 'tests: fix handling of TIMEOUT_SCALING_FACTOR

After reusing oslo.db common migration test cases
TIMEOUT_SCALING_FACTOR is now ignored and the general timeout value
(OS_TEST_TIMEOUT=160 defined in .testr.conf) is used for migration
test cases too, which may lead to occasional test failures depending
on the load of a test node.
In order to fix this we just need the migration test cases to inherit
Nova base test case again, so that Timeout fixture is properly used.

Closes-Bug: #1410235

Change-Id: Ic83475730a14aa5079b85b02ade76f49a0a15b39
(cherry picked from commit 2ca45a61ef5ce77db962ee6a2302dc2d35e3e5bd)
'}]
commit_message:
tests: fix handling of TIMEOUT_SCALING_FACTOR

After reusing oslo.db common migration test cases
TIMEOUT_SCALING_FACTOR is now ignored and the general timeout value
(OS_TEST_TIMEOUT=160 defined in .testr.conf) is used for migration
test cases too, which may lead to occasional test failures depending
on the load of a test node.
In order to fix this we just need the migration test cases to inherit
Nova base test case again, so that Timeout fixture is properly used.

Closes-Bug: #1410235

Change-Id: Ic83475730a14aa5079b85b02ade76f49a0a15b39
(cherry picked from commit 2ca45a61ef5ce77db962ee6a2302dc2d35e3e5bd)

commit_message:
Change '--id' to a positional argument.

E.g.

    magnum bay-show --id ae39f755-7d20-4348-8f49-23df9e473541

Becomes

    magnum bay-show ae39f755-7d20-4348-8f49-23df9e473541

This affects the following commands

bay-delete
bay-show
baymodel-delete
baymodel-show
container-delete
container-show
container-execute
container-logs
container-pause
container-reboot
container-start
container-stop
container-unpause
pod-delete
pod-show
rc-delete
rc-show
service-delete
service-show

Change-Id: Idb04c8bbc826aad6e5ea60074e18d90de9705e50
Closes-Bug: #1410579

commit_message:
Add telco working group usecase repo

We need to establish an review/approval process for TelcoWG use cases
(see [1] for more details).

The idea is to use the same tooling than OpenStack dev is doing.
Later on use cases can be used to give developers more details
about the context and the need.

[1]: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/TelcoWorkingGroup

Change-Id: I7148d702ada8ef68f1482cbe9529eed2b273c329

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-11 22:06:42.000000000', 'files': ['specs/kilo/db-volume-filtering.rst'], 'message': 'Generic filter support for volume queries

The filtering support of the volume DB APIs is inconsistent. For example,
filtering is supported when querying all volumes and when querying volumes
by project. However, filtering is not supported when querying volumes by host
or by group.

blueprint db-volume-filtering

Change-Id: I0c3e4a2f833c0f4e1e22cbda90fdcf90726e6544
'}]
commit_message:
Generic filter support for volume queries

The filtering support of the volume DB APIs is inconsistent. For example,
filtering is supported when querying all volumes and when querying volumes
by project. However, filtering is not supported when querying volumes by host
or by group.

blueprint db-volume-filtering

Change-Id: I0c3e4a2f833c0f4e1e22cbda90fdcf90726e6544

used.

subject: Do not send ETag in manifest object PUT request
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 455, 'name': 'Stuart McLaren', 'email': 'stuart.mclaren@hpe.com', 'username': 'stuart-mclaren'}, {'_account_id': 2537, 'name': 'Nikhil Komawar', 'email': 'nik.komawar@gmail.com', 'username': 'nikhil-komawar'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-29 18:23:16.000000000', 'files': ['glance_store/_drivers/swift/store.py'], 'message': 'Do not send ETag in manifest object PUT request

Do not send an ETag header when uploading a large object manifest
object to Swift.  Due to an implementation difference between
Ceph Swift and OS Swift, sending the ETag causes 422 Unprocessable
Entity errors from Ceph Swift.

Change-Id: I2fdc9b685adae2cae404748870c13980dd0d2971
Closes-bug: 1387311
'}]
commit_message:
Do not send ETag in manifest object PUT request

Do not send an ETag header when uploading a large object manifest
object to Swift.  Due to an implementation difference between
Ceph Swift and OS Swift, sending the ETag causes 422 Unprocessable
Entity errors from Ceph Swift.

Change-Id: I2fdc9b685adae2cae404748870c13980dd0d2971
Closes-bug: 1387311

commit_message:
Change default set of tox environments

Remove py33, since we don't test on 3.3 any more.

Remove pypy, since we don't need to test that locally by default (it may
still be tested in the gate).

Rather than keeping test input files in git, create them on the fly as
needed. This allows us to streamline one or two tests that modify the
files and then try to restore their old contents, and it also ensures
that looking at a given test it is clear which files are really being
used.

This change also updates the implementation of some tests that were
counting log calls to see how many files were loaded by making the
Enforcer track the files it loads so we can look at the list explicitly.
This gives us verification that the files we care about are the ones
being loaded, and is less brittle in case we change the logging
structure within the policy module.

Change-Id: I109b3d5afc622df7e5e7a12d06c4fb1baad18b1a
'}]
commit_message:
Create the temporary files needed for tests

Rather than keeping test input files in git, create them on the fly as
needed. This allows us to streamline one or two tests that modify the
files and then try to restore their old contents, and it also ensures
that looking at a given test it is clear which files are really being
used.

This change also updates the implementation of some tests that were
counting log calls to see how many files were loaded by making the
Enforcer track the files it loads so we can look at the list explicitly.
This gives us verification that the files we care about are the ones
being loaded, and is less brittle in case we change the logging
structure within the policy module.

Change-Id: I109b3d5afc622df7e5e7a12d06c4fb1baad18b1a

commit_message:
Move backend role tests into their own module

This is the first of a set of patches that break up the large
backend.py test module into more maintainable chunks. This
patch shows the structure proposed and the first piece
broken out (all the SQL tests for role management). A follow on
patch will do the same for the LDAP role management tests, and then
subsequent patches will split our resource, assignment, identity etc.

Partially Implements: blueprint backends-tests-restructuration

Change-Id: I0b24e2511f318e69a1a20f07ff3388f7a1975440

commit_message:
Generalize object dependency change detection

This adds functionality to the checks module that allows projects that
use this library to maintain a stored tree of object version relationships.
When they change, a test will fail, alerting developers or reviewers that
a parent version needs bumping, backport code needs to be written, and
general awareness about what is being changed is raised.

Change-Id: Ibedefcbfd2b85152710eb6f58e5aee8a4fd21510

commit_message:
Generalize object hash-based change detection

This adds functionality to the checks module that allows projects that
use this library to maintain a stored hash of each object such that if
it changes, a test will fail, alerting developers or reviewers that
a version needs bumping, a hash needs updating, and general awareness
about what is being changed is raised.

Change-Id: I1a3ff907f5ee50c67a8a20ee3fedafbf7c570ca6

(v2/zones/<zone_id>/tasks/abandon). All the other

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-18 14:17:55.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/api/ec2/test_cloud.py'], 'message': "Fix DB access by FormatMappingTestCase

Change I682a377d769312e8f37f874aa4548665b3b52ed3 made this test
inherit from NoDBTestCase. However, this test does access the db if
ec2utils.get_int_id_from_snapshot_uuid() can't return a value from its
memo cache. That is, it was only passing due to fortunate test
ordering which populated this cache in a previous test. If you ran the
test isolated, it failed.

This change mocks ec2utils.id_to_ec2_snap_id to return expected values
without touching the db.

Change-Id: I9e44f93dba5d56bf8c3dd3fda28a9b54eb95507f
"}]
commit_message:
Fix DB access by FormatMappingTestCase

Change I682a377d769312e8f37f874aa4548665b3b52ed3 made this test
inherit from NoDBTestCase. However, this test does access the db if
ec2utils.get_int_id_from_snapshot_uuid() can't return a value from its
memo cache. That is, it was only passing due to fortunate test
ordering which populated this cache in a previous test. If you ran the
test isolated, it failed.

This change mocks ec2utils.id_to_ec2_snap_id to return expected values
without touching the db.

Change-Id: I9e44f93dba5d56bf8c3dd3fda28a9b54eb95507f

commit_message:
Add subject_dn validator

This patch adds a validator for subject_dn and the corresponding
unit test.  It imports the ldap library to perform the check.
The ldap library is added to requirements.

Change-Id: Ibf7c1842e332167519d43bac53078b49daefeed4
Implements: blueprint certificate-order-api

commit_message:
Update all plugins to handle dimensions correctly

Updated the plugin code to handle the dimensions from the agent config,
the plugin config and dimensions defined in the code correctly.
Also removed the old-style plugin configuration code from several of
the plugins and added a command-line option to monasca-setup to pass
the log_level if desired instead of hard-coding it in the config.
This will make it easier to test in debug mode. Fixed an issue
with the Swift detection plugin.

Change-Id: I679457e5e1f302b0cdc87b0f0f799a42a9fa0ba4

When a host have a python package installed and this package older then the one
required by openstack subprojects, devstack is can fail since 'pip install'

commit_message:
Set pip_install default behavior to 'upgrade'

When a host have a python package installed and this package older then the one
required by openstack subprojects, devstack is can fail since 'pip install'
will skip the installation and leave the old version. This change adds the
--upgrade/-U option to pip_install so devstack always uses the version required
by projects.

Closes-Bug: #1419767
Change-Id: Idfeaa8b1c6e55af86e12b8677bc10d9f9c226247

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 741, 'name': 'Kiall Mac Innes', 'email': 'kiall@macinnes.ie', 'username': 'kiall'}, {'_account_id': 8099, 'name': 'Graham Hayes', 'email': 'gr@ham.ie', 'username': 'graham'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-16 20:49:14.000000000', 'files': ['designate/central/service.py', 'designate/api/v2/controllers/recordsets.py', 'designate/tests/test_api/test_v2/test_zones.py', 'designate/api/v2/controllers/zones/__init__.py', 'designate/tests/test_api/test_v2/test_recordsets.py'], 'message': "Deleting a recordset returns 202

* Update the recordset's status correctly before deleting it.
* Deleting a zone now returns 202 with the zone, showing
the status and action
* Deleting a recordset now returns 202 with the recordset,
showing the status and action

One issue still remains (needs a different fix):
Deleting a recordset without any records returns 202,
but the recordset returned shows a status of 'ACTIVE'
and not 'PENDING'. This is because recordset does
not have a status field.

Change-Id: Id7bf645adbbf8eadc509781a4ab16bef51f0536f
Closes-Bug: 1420359
"}]
commit_message:
Deleting a recordset returns 202

* Update the recordset's status correctly before deleting it.
* Deleting a zone now returns 202 with the zone, showing
the status and action
* Deleting a recordset now returns 202 with the recordset,
showing the status and action

One issue still remains (needs a different fix):
Deleting a recordset without any records returns 202,
but the recordset returned shows a status of 'ACTIVE'
and not 'PENDING'. This is because recordset does
not have a status field.

Change-Id: Id7bf645adbbf8eadc509781a4ab16bef51f0536f
Closes-Bug: 1420359

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-17 20:51:57.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_host.py'], 'message': "libvirt: stub out VIR_SECRET_USAGE_TYPE_ISCSI for older libvirt

The LibvirtDistroSupportMatrix says we support at least 0.9.8 on Ubuntu
Precise 12.04 LTS and on that version the VIR_SECRET_USAGE_TYPE_ISCSI
constant is not defined in libvirt.h.in so we need to mock it out in the
tests that are using it until we've completely removed any chance of
using a native libvirt and rely solely on fakelibvirt for stubbing out
these values in unit tests.

Closes-Bug: #1422385

Change-Id: Ifb519caf7456cfc8beabdd48df8a86c78150b3db
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: stub out VIR_SECRET_USAGE_TYPE_ISCSI for older libvirt

The LibvirtDistroSupportMatrix says we support at least 0.9.8 on Ubuntu
Precise 12.04 LTS and on that version the VIR_SECRET_USAGE_TYPE_ISCSI
constant is not defined in libvirt.h.in so we need to mock it out in the
tests that are using it until we've completely removed any chance of
using a native libvirt and rely solely on fakelibvirt for stubbing out
these values in unit tests.

Closes-Bug: #1422385

Change-Id: Ifb519caf7456cfc8beabdd48df8a86c78150b3db

commit_message:
Expose stop_workflow in API

Client sometimes needs to stop the workflow. Most often, when there is
an obvious error and it makes no sense to wait for completion. Or
when execution got to zombie state by any reasons.

Provide an ability to force-stop the workflow, pass SUCCESS or
ERROR, and status message for client message or error info.

- [x] Add public method and tests to default_engine.
- [x] Expose stop_workflow in rpc.
- [x] Expose in API.
- [x] Add a functional test.

Change-Id: I1bee7d9d780c1b1d09bc146843c751802e68f8fc

subject: Generalize remote testing infrastructure
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 10787, 'name': 'Michal Jastrzebski (inc0)', 'email': 'michal.jastrzebski@intel.com', 'username': 'inc0'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-02-17 16:53:33.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_versionedobjects/checks.py', 'oslo_versionedobjects/tests/test_objects.py'], 'message': 'Generalize remote testing infrastructure

This adds a new oslo_versionedobjects.checks module that provides tools
for projects that use this library to perform standard tests. This also
refactors the _LocalTest and _RemoteTest bits into a generalized fixture
for testing the IndirectionAPI and ensuring that everything is RPC-clean.

Now, the aforementioned test classes are just used for setup of our

they had before.

Change-Id: I5611f77a1bd847b368ecb1b8b5749716e5cf4ea9
'}]
commit_message:
Generalize remote testing infrastructure

This adds a new oslo_versionedobjects.checks module that provides tools
for projects that use this library to perform standard tests. This also
refactors the _LocalTest and _RemoteTest bits into a generalized fixture
for testing the IndirectionAPI and ensuring that everything is RPC-clean.

Now, the aforementioned test classes are just used for setup of our
tests, and they use the fixture instead of the "testable conductor" bits
they had before.

Change-Id: I5611f77a1bd847b368ecb1b8b5749716e5cf4ea9

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-02-17 16:53:33.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_versionedobjects/base.py', 'oslo_versionedobjects/tests/test_objects.py'], 'message': 'Add conditional object registration

This adds a register_if() method to the object registry, which allows for
conditional registration of the object class. It does, however, always
build the class properties and remotable methods, even if registration is
not performed. This is useful when it is desirable to control which
implementation of an object is used, or for testing purposes.

Change-Id: I0deb82744e7db659e8e75ce300b2c5417830f18d

commit_message:
Add conditional object registration

This adds a register_if() method to the object registry, which allows for
conditional registration of the object class. It does, however, always
build the class properties and remotable methods, even if registration is
not performed. This is useful when it is desirable to control which
implementation of an object is used, or for testing purposes.

Change-Id: I0deb82744e7db659e8e75ce300b2c5417830f18d

commit_message:
Remove Nova objects module registration code

This removes the (commented-out) Nova code that maintains the objects
module and provides a registration_hook() method on the registry that
will allow Nova (et al) to do the same thing with the new registry.

Change-Id: I0d7c84d3512bb72f9d17bb6908f4838bc01de7ea

subject: Generalize the indirection_api interface
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 10787, 'name': 'Michal Jastrzebski (inc0)', 'email': 'michal.jastrzebski@intel.com', 'username': 'inc0'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-02-17 16:53:33.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_versionedobjects/base.py', 'oslo_versionedobjects/tests/test_objects.py'], 'message': "Generalize the indirection_api interface

This removes the notion and mention of nova's conductor from the public api,
and clearly defines the things that the indirection API needs to support.
In Nova, this is effectively just the conductor interface, but since we
don't have that here, we introduce a VersionedObjectIndirectionAPI class that
defines the interface and rules.

Change-Id: I0967232b3c6971eaf6b376551d12e3351fd93283
"}]
commit_message:
Generalize the indirection_api interface

This removes the notion and mention of nova's conductor from the public api,
and clearly defines the things that the indirection API needs to support.
In Nova, this is effectively just the conductor interface, but since we
don't have that here, we introduce a VersionedObjectIndirectionAPI class that
defines the interface and rules.

Change-Id: I0967232b3c6971eaf6b376551d12e3351fd93283

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-12 04:44:14.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': 'Fix plugin.sh to handle OFFLINE=True mode.

In offline mode, install_opendaylight function
tries to do "wget" the opendaylight distribution.
This stops the devstack installation.

Closes-Bug: #1415601

Change-Id: I12c84f2ac7c1a7fe90b6e38f45e943f53e13e049

commit_message:
Fix plugin.sh to handle OFFLINE=True mode.

In offline mode, install_opendaylight function
tries to do "wget" the opendaylight distribution.
This stops the devstack installation.

This patch will fix this problem.

Closes-Bug: #1415601

Change-Id: I12c84f2ac7c1a7fe90b6e38f45e943f53e13e049

commit_message:
Reduce galera gcache size for commit check on AIO

This patch reduces the galera cache size for the AIO configuration in
order to improve the success of tempest tests on a low memory instance.

Co-Authored-By: Hugh Saunders <hugh@wherenow.org>
Partial-Bug: #1419094
Change-Id: I837abe7d53a862e2b3838f66f9cc90d4eb02fafd

commit_message:
mirror/ubuntu: speed up downloading the packages

Create an alternative APT config/state instead of making a chroot.
Calculate packages' dependencies in parallel.

blueprint support-ubuntu-trusty
Change-Id: I27545b9f3bc1393803b953919ea7f077c23f3245

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-16 22:24:30.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/api/controllers/secrets.py'], 'message': 'Refactor _lookup for secrets

The way the _lookup function in the controllers is documented (in the
pecan documentation), the actual lookup of the entity is actually
done in that function. So this CR changes that for the "secrets"
entity. Which actually reduces code repetition throughout that
controller.

Change-Id: I4e223b106f7072ce95fd075d91dc088d90ec1b71

commit_message:
Refactor _lookup for secrets

The way the _lookup function in the controllers is documented (in the
pecan documentation), the actual lookup of the entity is actually
done in that function. So this CR changes that for the "secrets"
entity. Which actually reduces code repetition throughout that
controller.

Change-Id: I4e223b106f7072ce95fd075d91dc088d90ec1b71

Whatever the endpoint type passed with --os-endpoint-type or
OS_ENDPOINT_TYPE, the publicURL is always used (instead of, for
instance, adminURL or internalURL).

This patch passes the user-defined endpoint type to keystoneclient's

commit_message:
Fix non-working endpoint type argument

Whatever the endpoint type passed with --os-endpoint-type or
OS_ENDPOINT_TYPE, the publicURL is always used (instead of, for
instance, adminURL or internalURL).

This patch passes the user-defined endpoint type to keystoneclient's
get_endpoint() so that the correct endpoint is chosen from the catalog.

Change-Id: Iee9f0e576d5fba3b4bf1dd267dfee233b0a7ea8f
Closes-Bug: #1422487

revisions:
[{'number': 20, 'created': '2015-02-17 08:34:37.000000000', 'files': ['manila/tests/api/v1/test_shares.py', 'contrib/devstack/extras.d/70-manila.sh', 'manila/api/v1/shares.py', 'manila/common/config.py', 'contrib/devstack/lib/manila'], 'message': 'Add support of default share type

Implement possibility to set up default share type for share creation.
If default share type is set up and in case no share type is specified,
a default share type will be provided with the share creation request.
It is useful when we want some specific back end to be used in common
cases instead of weighed back ends.

How to use it:

1) add to manila.conf file following option
default_share_type = some_st_name
to [DEFAULT] group of config.
2) restart manila API service if was started
3) create share type with name "some_st_name"
4) add some extra specs to share type, for example:
share_backend_name = cheap_backend

Implements blueprint default-volume-type

Change-Id: Ief32825360cbb3e7df9149e8980c11c5018f52f7
'}]
commit_message:
Add support of default share type

Implement possibility to set up default share type for share creation.
If default share type is set up and in case no share type is specified,
a default share type will be provided with the share creation request.
It is useful when we want some specific back end to be used in common
cases instead of weighed back ends.

How to use it:

1) add to manila.conf file following option
default_share_type = some_st_name
to [DEFAULT] group of config.
2) restart manila API service if was started
3) create share type with name "some_st_name"
4) add some extra specs to share type, for example:
share_backend_name = cheap_backend

Implements blueprint default-volume-type

Change-Id: Ief32825360cbb3e7df9149e8980c11c5018f52f7

commit_message:
rest: implement complex query for resource listing

This is directly stolen from Ceilometer complex query support and uses
the same query format.

For now it's only implemented in indexer and the REST API is not
modified (yet), but uses this new capability to build the current query
offered by the REST API.

Change-Id: I75aaf94987e93d8b2ad745373fd485f682edd901

subject: Add handling for offlined CPUs to the nova libvirt driver.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1779, 'name': 'Daniel Berrange', 'email': 'berrange@redhat.com', 'username': 'berrange'}, {'_account_id': 2271, 'name': 'Michael Still', 'email': 'mikal@stillhq.com', 'username': 'mikalstill'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5511, 'name': 'Nikola Dipanov', 'email': 'ndipanov@redhat.com', 'username': 'ndipanov'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 5754, 'name': 'Alex Xu', 'email': 'hejie.xu@intel.com', 'username': 'xuhj'}, {'_account_id': 7730, 'name': 'Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui', 'email': 'sahid.ferdjaoui@industrialdiscipline.com', 'username': 'sahid'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10068, 'name': 'Welcome, new contributor!', 'username': 'welcome-message'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11103, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'otc_cloud@163.com', 'username': 'intelotccloud', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14594, 'name': 'Alexander Schmidt', 'email': 'alexs@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'alexs'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-02-17 17:34:54.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/host.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/fakelibvirt.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "Add handling for offlined CPUs to the nova libvirt driver.

When a host system has CPUs that are offlined via CPU hotplug, nova
fails to start an instance on the host. Currently the libvirt driver
does not check if the CPUs it selects for running the instance are
online or offline. As a result, CPUs that are offline can become
part of the cpuset that is passed to libvirt. Libvirt presents
the following error in this case:

libvirtError: Invalid value '8-15,24-31' for 'cpuset.cpus': Invalid
argument

With this fix, the nova libvirt driver makes use of the getCPUMap
API in libvirt to determine if CPUs are online or offline. When
selecting a CPU set for running an instance, offline CPUs are
masked out.

Rationale: on server platforms like s390, it is common to have offlined
CPUs on a host as the platform offers capabilities to run multiple host
operatings systems (e.g. multiple KVM hypervisors / compute nodes). CPUs
can dynamically be assigned to the different host operating systems, so
it is common to have offlined CPUs on a compute node.

Change-Id: I506ebc9608e17e02d807e5002fe867309c22aafc
Closes-Bug: #1417144
"}]
commit_message:
Add handling for offlined CPUs to the nova libvirt driver.

When a host system has CPUs that are offlined via CPU hotplug, nova
fails to start an instance on the host. Currently the libvirt driver
does not check if the CPUs it selects for running the instance are
online or offline. As a result, CPUs that are offline can become
part of the cpuset that is passed to libvirt. Libvirt presents
the following error in this case:

libvirtError: Invalid value '8-15,24-31' for 'cpuset.cpus': Invalid
argument

With this fix, the nova libvirt driver makes use of the getCPUMap
API in libvirt to determine if CPUs are online or offline. When
selecting a CPU set for running an instance, offline CPUs are
masked out.

Rationale: on server platforms like s390, it is common to have offlined
CPUs on a host as the platform offers capabilities to run multiple host
operatings systems (e.g. multiple KVM hypervisors / compute nodes). CPUs
can dynamically be assigned to the different host operating systems, so
it is common to have offlined CPUs on a compute node.

Change-Id: I506ebc9608e17e02d807e5002fe867309c22aafc
Closes-Bug: #1417144

commit_message:
actually save hook logs

We've not been saving the hook logs because we are attempting to do
the save without enough permissions.

example:

http://logs.openstack.org/94/156594/1/check/check-swift-dsvm-functional/310e7a6//console.html#_2015-02-17_14_38_21_451

All other logs are moved with sudo, we should do that here as well.

For test purposes we make SUDO overridable for this call. In the
future we can consider what other SUDO calls are possibly overridable.

Change-Id: I6d4a378edd65cbe54243f8089ed9d0bc2b1a6478

Ensure that a resize operation will work on ephemeral disks. If the
flavor or block device mapping require ephemerals then these will be
updated or created. The user is able to go from a flavor with or without
ephemerals to a flavor with or without ephemerals.
The resize will honor the configuration.

Change-Id: I4b45299fdce59f4c52458d7515d0092b9f3b8db5

commit_message:
VMware: fix resize of ephemeral disks

Ensure that a resize operation will work on ephemeral disks. If the
flavor or block device mapping require ephemerals then these will be
updated or created. The user is able to go from a flavor with or without
ephemerals to a flavor with or without ephemerals.
The resize will honor the configuration.

DocImpact - Resize of ephemeral disks no works for VMware driver.

Change-Id: I4b45299fdce59f4c52458d7515d0092b9f3b8db5

commit_message:
Sync deployment tasks for installed releases

During upgrade of master node sync of deployment tasks will be performed
for newly added releases.

For each release directory: /etc/puppet/{RELEASE_VERSION} will be used
Tasks will be matched by unix file pattern, that is *tasks.yaml

Closes-Bug: 1419831
related to blueprint granular-deployment-based-on-tasks

Change-Id: Ia2159e91fbd7fa6d6d1b268ebc429339ad12bf16

commit_message:
make swiftclient functional job use swiftclient from git

This fix allows the swiftclient functional job to use swiftclient from
git, instead of only from pypi, which is needed for testing commits to
the client.

Change-Id: Ib239e55993b6cdc462db7b9854061b7352bbdccd

commit_message:
New integration tests - base functional

Features:
* create node group templates
* create cluster templates
* create clusters
* check cluster status
* default templates for hdp and vanilla plugins

Command for run tests:
$ tox -e scenario <path_to_yaml>

partially implements bp: scenario-integration-tests

Change-Id: Ief6aafff713520c972846aa45f0aaefd34ea1bd7

commit_message:
have swift functional tests use tox

the swift functional tests should use tox targets when run in the gate
so that their test requirements can be specified in the swift project
itself, instead of being bound to what might be available in the base
image.

Depends-On: I730f1bb530215ba7c30bf32a1c3bbc16edd5c217

Change-Id: Ida1ee74162cb3b0f575364f9e4bf7742ccd9a794

commit_message:
Fetching info about master node liveness

Creation and modification dates of stats from
installation_structures table are added into get_oswls function.
Now we are selecting only required fields in get_oswls funciton.
Oswl resource_checksum and id fields removed from CSV report.

Change-Id: Ib0f00ed2bac8758988b512cc067ce74a66b7f3d8

commit_message:
ec2: Change FormatMappingTestCase to NoDBTestCase

The test doesn't hit the database at all so make it
a NoDBTestCase.

As far as I can tell this is the last ec2 API unit test
class that isn't a trivial convert to NoDBTestCase, all
the rest require some mocking of the objects or DB API
layers to convert them to NoDBTestCase, which I plan to
work on in later patches.

Change-Id: I682a377d769312e8f37f874aa4548665b3b52ed3

CSV exporter for all OSWL resource types

An DBDuplicateEntry expection appeared if it is attempted to
create secutity groups in more then one thread. In this situation
at one moment it is trying to be created 2 default security groups
which is not allowed. In this case exception should skipped with
a message about failed attempt.

Closes-bug: #1419723

Change-Id: Id6fe997ad3b72f875160e1e31a3dc17c3cc53b75
'}]
commit_message:
Skip DBDuplicateEntry exception in security group creation

An DBDuplicateEntry expection appeared if it is attempted to
create secutity groups in more then one thread. In this situation
at one moment it is trying to be created 2 default security groups
which is not allowed. In this case exception should skipped with
a message about failed attempt.

Closes-bug: #1419723

Change-Id: Id6fe997ad3b72f875160e1e31a3dc17c3cc53b75

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1192, 'name': 'David Kranz', 'email': 'dkranz@redhat.com', 'username': 'david-kranz'}, {'_account_id': 1921, 'name': 'Andrea Frittoli', 'email': 'andrea.frittoli@gmail.com', 'username': 'andrea-frittoli'}, {'_account_id': 5803, 'name': 'Attila Fazekas', 'email': 'afazekas@redhat.com', 'username': 'afazekas'}, {'_account_id': 8556, 'name': 'Ghanshyam', 'display_name': 'Ghanshyam Maan', 'email': 'gmaan@ghanshyammann.com', 'username': 'ghanshyam'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10969, 'name': 'Shnaidman Sagi (Sergey)', 'display_name': 'Shnaidman Sagi', 'email': 'sshnaidm@redhat.com', 'username': 'sergsh'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-09 08:47:59.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/scenario/test_load_balancer_basic.py'], 'message': "Restore the persistent server option in the LB tests

The cb85dcdf5e2cf53ac21bb97382e03a8c5b47042f putted the
nc command into loop in order to tolerate busybox/nc versions
without persistent server option (cirros 0.3.3).

Unfortunately the above change also changed -ll option to -l.
The nc with -ll option provides 'never stop listening' service,
without this behavior the test can fail frequently/always
in several setup.

This change restores the -ll option, which does not causes issues
when you use  cirros 0.3.3 image, and gives stability with cirros 0.3.2
 + haproxy 1.5.x.

Note: The gate is using 0.3.2 cirros and HaProxy 1.4.x,
On the gate this change effectively restores the behavior before
cb85dcdf5e2cf53ac21bb97382e03a8c5b47042f.

Change-Id: I87bee99946447dee499ab3b8ca2b1cacb54668fd
Related-Bug: #1408922
Related-Bug: #1384708
"}]
commit_message:
Restore the persistent server option in the LB tests

The cb85dcdf5e2cf53ac21bb97382e03a8c5b47042f putted the
nc command into loop in order to tolerate busybox/nc versions
without persistent server option (cirros 0.3.3).

Unfortunately the above change also changed -ll option to -l.
The nc with -ll option provides 'never stop listening' service,
without this behavior the test can fail frequently/always
in several setup.

This change restores the -ll option, which does not causes issues
when you use  cirros 0.3.3 image, and gives stability with cirros 0.3.2
 + haproxy 1.5.x.

Note: The gate is using 0.3.2 cirros and HaProxy 1.4.x,
On the gate this change effectively restores the behavior before
cb85dcdf5e2cf53ac21bb97382e03a8c5b47042f.

Change-Id: I87bee99946447dee499ab3b8ca2b1cacb54668fd
Related-Bug: #1408922
Related-Bug: #1384708

commit_message:
Make compute API create() use BDM objects

Once we have consolidated all the block device information for an
instance coming from different sources (request, image metadata) we turn
them into objects and use objects update_or_create() for saving them into
the database.

Blueprint: kilo-objects

Change-Id: I9a70761d6a0a448cfbaf7102c45d6dc180a4cdea

commit_message:
XenAPI: Recommend using xl console rather than vncviewer

Some vncviewers do not support the -via option, so default to suggesting
xl console.  XenCenter continues to be an option for those running
Windows.

Change-Id: I1e53fd33d309e30a60031965e589167dcbacfbbe

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-17 00:57:09.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/scenario/test_network_basic_ops.py'], 'message': 'Skip new instance port admin state test for ironic

This new test toggles the admin state of instance ports and
expects this to alter connectivity via public IP.  However,
baremetal instances are attached to physical ports that cannot
be switched up and down via neutron.  This adds a skip in this
case.

Change-Id: I908331a913fbe791a04d20060deb5a0001367b67
'}]
commit_message:
Skip new instance port admin state test for ironic

This new test toggles the admin state of instance ports and
expects this to alter connectivity via public IP.  However,
baremetal instances are attached to physical ports that cannot
be switched up and down via neutron.  This adds a skip in this
case.

Change-Id: I908331a913fbe791a04d20060deb5a0001367b67

commit_message:
docker/module.mk: don't depend on Debian packages

At the moment docker containers are based on CentOS, thus building
containers does not require any Debian packages. Cuts a few minutes
from the ISO build time.

blueprint support-ubuntu-trusty

Change-Id: Ib3e615b4c2b0298e36a65eb00bcbc135e909e0de

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-08-28 19:06:32.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/nova_network/nova_manage.rb'], 'message': '--vlan is not the same as --vlan_start

the lib/puppet/provider/nova_network/nova_manage.rb provider was using
the --vlan option when it meant --vlan_start.  This caused "network
create" commands with num_networks > 1 to fail with "duplicate vlan"
errors.

Change-Id: Ibdca3b8de72b459eacf8b44b6350b9bc71310c1b
Closes-bug: #1362772
'}]
commit_message:
--vlan is not the same as --vlan_start

the lib/puppet/provider/nova_network/nova_manage.rb provider was using
the --vlan option when it meant --vlan_start.  This caused "network
create" commands with num_networks > 1 to fail with "duplicate vlan"
errors.

Change-Id: Ibdca3b8de72b459eacf8b44b6350b9bc71310c1b
Closes-bug: #1362772

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-18 09:55:35.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/openstack/manifests/cinder.pp', 'deployment/puppet/openstack/manifests/controller.pp', 'deployment/puppet/openstack/manifests/compute.pp'], 'message': "Override cinder-volume service only for Cinder role

W/o this fix, tweaks::ubuntu_service_override { 'cinder-volume' }
is called for controller and compute roles as well as for cinder role
and that causes the double declaration conflict.
The solution is to invoke this override only for cinder role.

Change-Id: I3b49968bb1c38d55cece507e0e7f5b950f890c1f
Closes-bug: #1422579
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Override cinder-volume service only for Cinder role

W/o this fix, tweaks::ubuntu_service_override { 'cinder-volume' }
is called for controller and compute roles as well as for cinder role
and that causes the double declaration conflict.
The solution is to invoke this override only for cinder role.

Change-Id: I3b49968bb1c38d55cece507e0e7f5b950f890c1f
Closes-bug: #1422579
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Make diagnostic snapshot on base_test errors

Sometimes Fuel Master node CI job fails during master node setup
and no diagnostic snapshot is made, which makes debugging almost
impossible.

Change-Id: I1a87fc408ccf95cec12a69f2fd20272209c60e8a

Update requirements for environment variables

The following environment variables are not required anymore:

  OS_REGION_NAME
  OS_TENANT_ID

commit_message:
Add manage_service feature

puppet-swift lacks of disabling service managing. This patch adds
$manage_service and $enabled parameter to all relevant classes.

Closes-bug: #1359823
Change-Id: I3d632e3a26e9394d03d94089ae704904bf77aa51

commit_message:
Switch nova.compute.manager to use instance dot notation

nova.compute.manager should use instance objects with the
field access dot notation everywhere. Essentially we use
instance.key instead of instance['key'].

Change-Id: I5bd2e1b24f60e15522574cb9d0c019831d7328b1

commit_message:
Fixes plugin.ini error

When executing the cisco.pp manifest it throws an error
if the plugin.ini file is already declared.

commit_message:
Add simple integration tests for OpenStack actions

For the current moment we have tests for some OpenStack action for Mistral v1,
to cover main functionality of these actions in v2 new test suite was added.
New tests will check that all implemented OpenStack actions are in the working
state and Mistral can connect to OpenStack components like Heat, Nova, etc.
and execute basic operation: get list of objects.

Change-Id: Ie6cda877c12509e23a81ccf5da48d870229b3779

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-18 03:54:25.000000000', 'files': ['rally/cmd/commands/task.py'], 'message': 'Add user-friendly message if the task cannot be deleted

If the final status of the task is unfinished(verifying, running) despite
the rally process is not running any more because the rally process was
crashed (For example, killed the rally process), could not delete the task
and outputed confusable trace error message.
Therefore changed it not to output confusable trace error message and
print user-friendly message("Use '--force' option to delete the task with
vague state.").

Change-Id: Ia5c25022b026c683cdfdfcc6f94928d27e39b9f7
Closes-Bug: #1421142
'}]
commit_message:
Add user-friendly message if the task cannot be deleted

If the final status of the task is unfinished(verifying, running) despite
the rally process is not running any more because the rally process was
crashed (For example, killed the rally process), could not delete the task
and outputed confusable trace error message.
Therefore changed it not to output confusable trace error message and
print user-friendly message("Use '--force' option to delete the task with
vague state.").

Change-Id: Ia5c25022b026c683cdfdfcc6f94928d27e39b9f7
Closes-Bug: #1421142

commit_message:
Add context that pre-creates heat stacks

Add custom context that creates a bunch of stacks with resources.
After test context cleanups all stacks from heat.
The context allows is needed for testing such scenario as
"list_stack", "list_resources" and others, where stacks shoule be
created before test.

Change-Id: I74ea1b1379dba68e306ad49bc8fb2291d7cf22e7

commit_message:
Remove root_helper arg for ovs_lib

Stop passing root_helper in ovs_lib classes and instead rely on
execute() looking up the root_helper from the config.

Partially-Implements: blueprint rootwrap-daemon-mode
Change-Id: I24c29a1964582dabaa04358e05be903c8cb49229

commit_message:
Search in /sys/class/net for network devices

When using /sys/devices/net/virtual to search for tap devices, not all
devices are listed there (i.e. when using Xen).
Also according to the Linux kernel documentation (see
ABI/testing/sysfs-devices), /sys/class should be used
instead of /sys/devices.

Change-Id: I9b4981332b66b6d3f9c36511c81432d3e7644bdd
Closes-Bug: #1419754

commit_message:
Sync policy module from oslo-incubator

The policy module has not had a sync since back in
November.  There have been a number of changes that
should be pulled into Kilo.

Current HEAD in OSLO:
---------------------
commit 9bf01f9d98487cb13e3d95ad2a580fe8fc6f2479
Date:  Fri Feb 13 14:18:58 2015 -0500
Switch from oslo.config to oslo_config

Changes merged with this patch:
---------------------
2aacb111 Change oslo.config to oslo_config
2fbf5065 Remove oslo.log code and clean up versionutils API
262279b1 switch to oslo_serialization
07e9b32a Improving docstrings for policy API
e67f5cd0 Merge "Don't log missing policy.d as a warning"
99d991ce Merge "Fixed a problem with neutron http policy check"
b19af080 Don't log missing policy.d as a warning
2324c775 Add rule overwrite flag to Enforcer class
6166a960 Fixed a problem with neutron http policy check

Closes-bug: 1288178
Change-Id: I6987029b9c15f3d35fa591014859f5f96c98f3a3

commit_message:
Openstack-haproxy and openstack-controller as a separate step

Includes updates for other classes to make them work correnctly
with new granular deployment process.

Package 'screen' removed from 'controller.pp' since it's being
installed by 'tools.pp' task.

Related blueprint fuel-library-modularization
Closes-bug: #1421856

Change-Id: Ie4389fe62a5516ede56c0e79791e40ef1e339bbd

commit_message:
Cluster-haproxy as a separate step

Related blueprint fuel-library-modularization

This patch is needed for openstack-haproxy and
openstack-controller tasks and will not pass CI
until merged together with them.

Fuel-CI: disable
Change-Id: I3298787161151aac3516b521f66edd46d4d5b150

script named 'cloud-init-per' is written in bash and can't work with
pipes correctly. So, long command lines with pipes should be
converted to a single command, eg:

/bin/sh -c 'echo command | tee /etc/file'

Without that, all those incorrectly handled commands will empty files

Closes-Bug: #1420396
"}]
commit_message:
[IBP] Fix idempotency issues in cloud-init boothooks

script named 'cloud-init-per' is written in bash and can't work with
pipes correctly. So, long command lines with pipes should be
converted to a single command, eg:

/bin/sh -c 'echo command | tee /etc/file'

Without that, all those incorrectly handled commands will empty files
on the every next boot after the first boot.

Change-Id: Ib49a21cde42264320ada882c9e06a4a0e09badfa
Closes-Bug: #1420396

commit_message:
[IBP] Fix idempotency issues in cloud-init boothooks

script named 'cloud-init-per' is written in bash and can't work with
pipes correctly. So, long command lines with pipes should be
converted to a single command, eg:

/bin/sh -c 'echo command | tee /etc/file'

Without that, all those incorrectly handled commands will empty files
on the every next boot after the first boot.

Change-Id: Ib49a21cde42264320ada882c9e06a4a0e09badfa
Closes-Bug: #1420396

commit_message:
Cleaning db before integration tests added

Complete cleaning of db schema added before execution of integration
tests. The main reason of introducing such cleaning - issue with
applying alembic revisions with same uid but different content that are
stored in different git branches, which leads to erros while interaction
with db.

Change-Id: I94611015beb4dd83d036b813c9337958dc6af064
Closes-Bug: #1421164

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-02-17 16:10:21.000000000', 'files': ['lib/tempest'], 'message': 'Enable setting "[volume] volume_size" in tempest.conf

Devstack wasn't able to set the tempest variable "volume_size" in the
[volume] section of the tempest configuration. The default size of 1GB
couldn't be changed then. This could lead to an issue when the guest
image size is bigger than that.
This patch fixes that by providing a new variable which sets the
volume_size in the tempest.conf file.

Closes-Bug: 1422396
Change-Id: I8053553a216636a5bd06d42a7aa2ebfff4a963e5
'}]
commit_message:
Enable setting "[volume] volume_size" in tempest.conf

Devstack wasn't able to set the tempest variable "volume_size" in the
[volume] section of the tempest configuration. The default size of 1GB
couldn't be changed then. This could lead to an issue when the guest
image size is bigger than that.
This patch fixes that by providing a new variable which sets the
volume_size in the tempest.conf file.

Closes-Bug: 1422396
Change-Id: I8053553a216636a5bd06d42a7aa2ebfff4a963e5

commit_message:
Implement better nova_admin_tenant_id_setter exists? method

Actually do some checking in the exists? method here to see if the
neutron.conf nova_admin_tenant_id setting is correct already.  That
way Puppet can properly recognize when the resource is already in
the right state.

Change-Id: I9692f4689683298cba4af1cacd700975f7e50b17
Closes-bug: 1392862
